characters: JAG GOES OVER RULES OF ENGAGEMENT
SEAL TEAM 10 CAMP OUELLETTE, BAGRAM AIR BASE
NO GO, NO GO, NO GO

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Through massive sun flare, a BLACKHAWK Chopper coming in fast. Landing hard on Bagram Air Base.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: (vo) It’s something most of us have known all of our lives. What we all wanted. It’s in our blood. A team of medical personal and Navy officers descend on t chopper. An assortment of high-ranking GENERALS and COMMANDING OFFICERS there to meet the chopper. Tight shot A bloody hand dangles. A tear filled eyeball, sliced feet LUTTRELL (CONT’D) (vo) There’s a storm inside of us. I’ve heard many team guys speak of this. A burning. A river. A drive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Clothes cut. Blood soaked Dog Tags cut. “Luttrell” in UA boxer shorts, IVs and fresh blood bags. Multiple Gunshots Chunk of an ear missing. Heartbeat monitor. Weak pulse.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: (vo) An unrelenting desire to push yourself harder and further than anyone could think possible. Chunks of bullet and shrapnel filling metal bowl. Tears streaming down cheeks, a hand scrawled map on a left thig focused eyes of surgeons. Admirals’ pace in the hallway. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) (vo) Pushing ourselves into those dark cold corners where the bad things live. Where the bad things fight. Heart monitor weak. Getting weaker. Compound fracture lef shin. Bloody feet rinsed clean. Water flushing out bullet holes. Loose cracked tooth pulled out. Heart monitor gett weaker. Surgical pack working franticly to save Luttrell. Tight on HEART MONITOR: FLATLINE

dialogues.speaker: 3B
dialogues.text: LUTTRELL CONT’D We wanted that fight at the highest volume. The loud fight. The loudest, coldest, hottest, most unpleasant of the unpleasant fights. Pushing in on the flatline. Alarm screaming. Tight on Luttrell’s eyes starting to glaze over. Dying. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: GRAPHIC
dialogues.text: “FIVE DAYS EARLIER”

dialogues.speaker: SUNSET.
dialogues.text: Rugged and punishing. Endless and infinite. Steep stone mountains. Bottomless valleys. Cold and dry. As we fly across this stunning land, from the bottom of t

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FOUR HELICOPTERS. Two MH-47s transport. Two security Apac

dialogues.speaker: IN THE CHOPPER
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON MARCUS LUTTRELL. Healthy and very clear eyed. 12 SEALs fully dressed for combat. Sitting side by side. Clearly ready for war.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seen from above. Cruising at 150 over the shoulder of a . cal TF-160 aviator door gunner.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Riding low and fast. Inside: Two Night Stalker Pilots, Tw Airmen, and 12 SEALs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Choppers tearing across the Afghan mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luttrell checks his map against his wrist strapped GPS. Whistles quietly to himself.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t see anything but steep. I could be wrong. Hope I’m wrong. If it’s anything but steep I’m not seeing it.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Just put your feet where I put my feet. All day long. You’re gonna love it. SHANE PATTON plugged into an iPod. SLIPKNOT pounding into head. He quietly sings along. Kristensen leans over to Axelson, the navigator, adjusts upper right strap on his front pack.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: I'm real interested in the pitch. If it ain’t fucking glorious, come back, try another route. Don’t waste your time trying to cross something that’s gonna knock the shit out of us.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Roger that. Kristensen moves over to MIKE MURPHY.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: She does not need a Arabic horse.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How do you know about that?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: I know everything Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Morab Tennessee Walking Horse cross stallion.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What?  3A.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Original Silver. Lone Ranger's Horse.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Tennessee cross stallion. That’s a fucking horse.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Lone Ranger’s horse of choice.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Sounds excellent sir.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Glorious horse Murphy. Tight on Luttrell starring into the plunging sun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: INTERCUT AFGHAN VILLAGE. Intro Afghan warlord. AHMAD SHAH 35 years old. Tall, strong. Fierce. He moves through an Afghan village with a small pack of equally fierce Taliba warriors. LOCAL AFGHANS avoid eye contact. This Shah and crew feel like an old school western bad guy moving through a cow t NOTHING like the SUICIDE BOMBERS of BAGDAD. These are rea warriors. Strong-jawed. Thin but ripped muscles. Worn ric soulful faces, vivid eyes, color reds and blues. Strong boots. Military vests. Good radio equipment. Well-maintai weapons. Shah’s number two is TARAQ. Late twenties. Shah is viciou TARAQ, is more vicious. Strong and very, very violent. A very worthy opponent. RIGHT now they are clearly pissed. Shah leads the way, wa with purpose. They are looking for a man. Someone has violated TALIBAN accused of aiding the Americans. Shah moves into a house. Women and children terrified. Trembling. Women pleading.

dialogues.speaker: SHAH SHAH
dialogues.text: Where is he? Hagha Cherta Dey? The women scream. As Shah starts throwing teenage boys ar the room. Slamming them viciously into walls. A 25-year-old man Gulab tries to reason with Shah. A YOUN BOY watches.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB GULAB
dialogues.text: Please, we want no trouble. Mehrabani/lutfan, monga hes mushkil no ghowaro Taragq throws Gulab down hard. Turns, locks eyes with an Afghan man(30s). Taraq moves quickly at him, kicking him the face, his foot down hard on his throat.

dialogues.speaker: SHAH SHAH
dialogues.text: Have you spoken with the Aya taso Americayano sara Americans? khaberi keri dey?

dialogues.speaker: AFGHAN MAN AFGHAN MAN
dialogues.text: Please! No! Mehrabani/lutfan! Na! Gulab watches. Frustrated. Furious.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ TARAQ
dialogues.text: You lie! Ta Dorogh wayee!

dialogues.speaker: AFGHAN MAN AFGHAN MAN
dialogues.text: Please! Mehrabani/lutfan!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s pressing down hard. Choking the man. The man’s famil begs and screams. Shah studies the Afghan deep into his e Decides he’s lying...Shah nods to Taraq. Taraq yanks the Afghan to his feet. As his children watch Taraq leads the pleading farmer outside. Into the woods. Taragq and his men throw the Afghan down over a fallen lo Face up. Two of Taraq’s men hold him by the beard as Taraq stands him. Razor sharp machete up. Shah backlit. Ignoring the man’s pleading...as Taraq hack down with brutal fury. Tight on Shah, tight on Taraq, blood dripping from his ha

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun just beginning to rise over the Base. Beautiful. Camera moves though the sleeping base. Guards man posts. Aircraft static on runways in Hangars’. Tent after tent soldiers’ sleep. We come to a small base within a base. 10 foot rebar fram dirt walls. Barbed wire. Heavy Iron gate. A fortress within a fortress. Graphic.

dialogues.speaker: SEAL TEAM 10 CAMP OUELLETTE, BAGRAM AIR BASE
dialogues.text: We move inside the SEAL compound. Several plywood buildin Assorted trucks, Jeeps, heavy ATVs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus Luttrell sleeps. Peaceful. Tight shots. Luttrell’s room. A Texas flag. Family pictures. Mom, Dad, twin Broth Morgan. SEAL Trident. Wanted poster Osama bin Laden. Guns knifes, grenades.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANNY DIETZ sleeps. His walls covered with his art. Demon and Dragons and Serpents. Beautiful and haunting. Picture his wife, Patsy. His dogs. His parents. Matt Axelson sleeps. Curly red hair. Pictures of his fami American flag. Freddie Couples walking the bridge at St. Andrews. Map of Afghanistan.

dialogues.speaker: MIKE MURPHY
dialogues.text: Rooms a mess. Clothes and gear everywhere. Grenades on a next to a copy of GATES OF FIRE. New York Rangers flag ne to a SEAL Flag, 8 x 10 head shot of Ron Burgundy. Tight on Murphy. His eyes slowly open. Hold a moment. Mur checks watch. 0500. Slow and smooth Murphy rises. Body strong. Not ripped. Effortless power. Murphy goes to his computer. Opens it and checks his mail Tight on Murphy’s inbox. A picture of an Arabian Horse. Murphy studies the picture

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy now in shorts and a Navy T-shirt. Holding his lapt eating a banana. Stops by Luttrell’s door. Opens it. Luttrell sleeps, Murphy sits on his bed. Nudges Luttrell. Luttrell opens an eye. He’s staring at the computer pic o Arabian horse.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Is this doable?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Expensive.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Arabic. She’s got good taste.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How much?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I'll find out. Expensive. Murphy is up. Heads out the door. Moves into the hallway. Opens Dietz’s door.  10

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (quiet) Danny. Dietz. Eyes closed.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I’m up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark, then lights on, revealing a decent cross fit style Blackboard filled with the current workout leaders. Dietz Murphy hold most of them. The two men start to stretch in silence. Luttrell wanders in. A giant bowl of cereal.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Since when does she want an Arabic horse?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Since I got an email this morning. Probably saw it on Oprah.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Oprah rides Arabic horses?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I don’t know what Oprah does.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: She can afford them.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Why? How much do they cost?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Oprah money.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I thought you guys were doing this tomorrow. Murphy and Dietz strap on Body Armor.  11 LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Maybe I’m starting to become tele fucking pathic - non-verbal yoda or something. I could swear I just said outloud, that I thought this was happening tomorrow. Murphy stretching.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I think Red Wings a go. Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Oh. (beat) Outstanding. SHANE PATTON wanders in.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: You're doing it now? The three men ignore Shane. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) (to Luttrell) They’re going at it now?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Looks that way. INT. MATT AXELSON’S BUNK - MORNING 11 Axe sleeps. His computer alarm goes off. Incoming voice c Slowly Axe reaches down for the computer on his floor. Axe opens the computer. Signs in. Incoming from his wife Cindy. “Bre you up?” Axe types. “Yes my love.” Cindy. “What you doing?” Axe stares at a picture of he and Cindy.  12 13

dialogues.speaker: 13A
dialogues.text: “Looking at you.”

dialogues.speaker: CINDY
dialogues.text: How do I look?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Like Heaven.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dietz and Murphy both warmed up clearly ready for some ki of competition. Luttrell sits on a weight bench. Takes off his watch. Dietz and Murphy under pull up bars. HEALY enters.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Thought you guys were doing this tomorrow...

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Ready?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Yup.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Mark. Set. Go. Luttrell hits the stop watch. Murphy and Dietz leap to bars, 75 Pull-ups as fast as possible. Brief pauses to recover. 100 push ups. Dietz slightly ahead of Murphy. Sprints out of the gym. Murphy close behind. The two men charge up and over the gate. Body Armor on. EXT. BAGRAM - MONTAGE -— MORNING 13 Murphy and Dietz running hard racing each other on a two lap of the Air Base. Luttrell keeps time. Shane starts bench pressing. Luttrell eats cereal. AXE in bunk room. On the computer with Cindy. 13A  “I won't be able to talk for a couple of days.” “Gotta go to work?” 9A.  14 10. “Got to pay the bills.” Murphy and Dietz sprinting. Dead even. Past Marines. Down runway full of active aircraft and helicopters.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shane benching big. Luttrell munches cereal. Healy doing pushups.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Am I going?

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: No idea

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: If I say I don’t know. I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: You know.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: If you go you'll go. If you don’t go, trust me you will go. Eventually. Comprende?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: So, I’m not going?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I didn’t say that.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: You said if you don’t go, you will eventually go.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yea, that’s not saying your not going.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: I’m not going. Shane back to bench pressing. Luttrell checks his watch, heads out towards the gate.  10A.

dialogues.speaker: 14A INT / EXT WEIGHT ROOM
dialogues.text: Other SEALs starting to gather. JAMES SUH, DAN HEALY, MIK MCGREEVY, JAQUES FONTAN, JEFF LUCAS and JEFF TAYLOR  11. Dietz and Murphy balls out sprinting. Murphy has him by a feet coming back to Ouellette iron wall. Murphy throws op the gate, runs inside. Dietz a second behind. Luttrell looks at his watch.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Murphy by 1.1. Exhausted Dietz and Murphy sit in the dirt. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Head shave?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Fuck. Axe walks up, shorts and flip flops.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Who won?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Murphy. Barely.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Head shave? Dietz looks pained.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Man...I got to think this one out. If I shave his head, I’m going to have to look at him. Really look at him. Ears, face, funny shaped head...I don’t know. Marcus? What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know boss...I don’t want to be looking at him that close either, but he has been running his mouth about beating you...a lot. Head shave is fair.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Axe?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hell yea, I say shave him, and he can’t eat with us, make him eat with E3 Marines until it grows back. Shave the boy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Shane?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Well, I could go both ways on this. He did lose but, he was close and you're Mike Murphy and I would have expected a much bigger separation. Plus, we’re at war and there’s the whole Samson thing, so I’m not sure. I'll plead the fifth on this one. Murphy looks stares at Shane. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) But you’re the boss, boss. So I’m with you. I’ll shave his head, wax his balls if you give me the order. Sir, I'll wax my own balls if you take me on Red Wings. Murphy shakes his head at Patton, looks over to Dietz.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Come on Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea Danny this is probably not gonna go your way. Shane, get my razor.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Getting razor, copy that. Erik Kristensen, officer in charge, from the deck of the Command Room. Shane stops. Turns around.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Not today. The SEALs stare up at their boss.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Red Wing’s a go. Today. 1800.  15 13.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Am I going?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: (ignoring Shane) PLO in one hour.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Sir? Kristensen dead eyes Patton. Turns and heads back into TO Healy follows

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Shane's going?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY SHANE
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. Maybe. They all walk inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty SEALs plus support packed into the TOC (Tactical Operational Command). Makeshift control center. PowerPoin flat screen. Operation REDWING is dissected.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Operation Red Wings. The target is Ahmad Shah and his, we are estimating ten men, “loyal amigos”. Including, this dude, Slide shifts to a color photo of “Taraq”.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Only have a first name, Taraq. Seems to do most of the chief shit for Shah. SEALs study photos.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're going in with a four man team. The recon team is Dietz, Comms. Axe, Nav. Luttrell, Medic.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Objective of this mission is to positively identify Ahmad Shah. Shane’s head in his hands, pissed he is not going...a gra photo of Ahmad Shah on a large color monitor. PowerPoint.  13A.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: This is the best picture we have of him. It’s current. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We know Shah killed fourteen Marines last Tuesday in Kandahar. We just pulled this video off three different Tali web sights. It will in fact be a glorious day when Ahmad Shah and his good friend Taraq are no longer members of our human community. Clear video of Shah executing a Taliban woman. Two men ho her down. Shah fires an AK-47. The bullet kicking up dust it blasts through her skull into the dirt. The SEALs study this footage. Dead serious.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Go back...freeze. Axe studies an image of Shah.

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: No earlobes.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What’s that?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: The guys got no earlobes. Silence as the team studies the image.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: What are earlobes for anyway?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Piercing and balance.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Balance.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I heard earlobes are key for head balance - equilibrium. Cut a guys ear off, he’s gonna suck on a drunk test, balance beam, tight rope...

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: False. Earlobes have no biological functions for humans. Fish can use earlobes like a valve to open or close the ear canal.  14~A.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE
dialogues.text: Why would a fish want to let water into his ear canal? Luttrell shoots him a look - “shut the fuck up”  15. Murphy keeps things moving.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Bad guy. Senior Taliban commander responsible for killing Marines in Eastern Afghanistan and sport killing civilians in the Hindu- Kush. Considered Tier One target rumored to be close to Bin Laden. Axe is going to go over our route in.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: The helo pilots are going to do two false inserts. Then drop us off at our primary insert, located here. Secondary insert located here. From our primary insert, our bearing will be zero three zero patrolling 1.5 kilometers to our designated lay up point. We will be moving up the backside of this mountain which will offer us good concealment from the target but the terrain is gonna be rocky so watch your footing. I’m estimating it’s gonna take us about two hours to complete.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Luttrell - medical

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: First things first, win the fight. There’s no medicine in a gunfight. It’s self aid, buddy aid, corpsman aide. Two weeks ago, Team 3 was near where you guys will be. Capelli got bit by a rattlesnake. and contrary to popular belief, there is poison oak, so watch the cock and balls cause that will suck. Drink lots of water, wear sunscreen, and Dietz bring your own chapstick. Dietz stands up, starts talking comms

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Crypto will be wide band, segment 2- 4. Murph’s got a SAT phone. Region is very steep so expect typical comms problems. We’1ll be on two hour comms windows. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we miss two windows I'd say wake somebody up. Other than that, don’t sweat it. Murphy picks up a plastic AC-130 and holds it over the ma

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Ac-130 is with us?  16. Dietz takes the plane from Murphy. Moves it over the map.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Correct. Just for the infil. All comms will be relayed through the AC-130, call sign Apollo. Suns up, she’s out. Some of the key pro- words - when we have a successful insert, Budweiser. When we’re halfway through infil, it’1ll be Corona. At our observation point, Schlitz Malt Liquor. And if we positively identify Shah: touchdown. Danny chucks the toy plane.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Reaction Force is the following: The 47’s will relocate to J-Bad overnight. Murphy uses toy plastic helicopters to explain the size a location of the QRF.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: That’s correct. You'll have fifteen team guys, and about a dozen Marines standing by all night. When we hear Schlitz Malt Liquor, we're heading back to Bagram for phase 2. QRF will stay here - we’re leaving you with 4 team guys, 20 marines, 2 Blackhawks and 2 Apaches. The Apaches stay with the Blackhawks. The toy Choppers circle on the map giving us a clear understanding of the playing field.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: The movement is so we can get the 47's back here and be ready to bring it for phase two once you get eyes on Shah. Remember - comms will most likely be intermittent and there are reports that non- combatants are being used as recon elements for the enemy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Roger that. Luttrell spits chew. Danny doodles furious, mashing demon Axe quietly studies the picture of Ahmad Shah.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Lotta moving parts.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What we do, when we do, what we do.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: We go in four hours. I’m pulling up tomorrow's new guy presentation to 1800 tonight so that all may revel and partake.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Are you serious?

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Yes. Glorious evening gentlemen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four SEALS moving through the massive base. Long hair bearded. Surfers with handguns stuck in waistbands. Sharp contrast to the hundreds of uniformed buzz-cutted Rangers Marines. They move at us, holding trays loaded with food.

dialogues.speaker: LAST SUPPER.
dialogues.text: Murphy, Luttrell, Axe and Dietz. Eating. Having a fly cat and kill competition. DIETZ looks stressed. He’s got a paint tile sample page on the table in front o him. Studying paint samples.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: We were gonna wait but she’s all into it and when she gets her head into something, that’s it. There’s no stopping her.  17A.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: So just let her do it. It’s good for her. You got a handy man woman. That’s good.  18. MURPHY kills a fly. Places the dead fly by his coffee cup next to three other dead flies.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Don’t know what?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: He’s worried that he’s losing control over his castle.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Really.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Ask him.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Are you worried that you're losing control over your castle?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Shut up Murph.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Are you?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: He’s having control issues cause he’s the one whose always made the “taste” issues in the family.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: She’s got great taste. I trust her.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: So what’s the problem?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: It’s not a problem. It’s just very ongoing. Know what I mean? Luttrell kills a fly. He’s got six dead ones. He and Murp are competing.  19.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Not really. No. Marcus, you know what he means?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Control issues.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Is that right?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: It’s not control issues.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What is it?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: New grass leads to new bushes by the window, leads to new windows, leads to new curtains, leads to new sofa, leads to new rug, leads to new floor...

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Got it.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Loss of control. Got to let that go bro.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: It’s like this weird journey that she’s on. Moving through the house one room to the next.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Where is she now?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Kitchen. I think. Murphy and Luttrell both kill flies at the same time. Mar with Buzz cuts in crisp uniform eating all around the SEA Stark contrast.  18 20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on Shane Patton. Doing his best Napoleon Dynamite dance. He is not good. SEALS in lounge chairs. They watch laugh and taunt. Music loud. Shane powers through. Finish strong. Whistles and clapping from the SEALS. AXE stands up. Puts arm around Patton.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: God was that awful

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Ok, here’s the deal. That sucked, but I’m voting that we move him forward cause I can’t watch this shit without puking anymore so I say lest be done with it. All in favor? Luttrell and all SEALs put their hands up, except Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on Mikey.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Can he say it? Other SEALS agree. Shouting out. Debating whether Shane c “say it”. Making bets. AXE knows what Murphy is thinking. Pauses. Looks at Shane

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: (quiet to Shane) Can you say it?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: I think so.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Think so?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: I can say it.  21.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Ok. Shut up. Shut the fuck up. He can say it. Shut up. The room silences. Patton, nervous, takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: (weak, then strong) I’ve been around the world twice, talked to everyone once. I’ve seen two whales fuck, been to three world fairs, and I even know a man in Thailand with a wooden cock. I’ve pushed more peter, more sweeter, and more completer than any other peter-pusher around. Tight on the SEALS smiling, some mouthing the words along with Shane. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) I am a hard-bodied, hairy-chested, rootin, tootin, shootin, parachutin, demolition double cap crimping Frogman.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire SEAL TEAM jocks up. Gets ready.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: (vo) There ain’t nothing I can’t do. No sky too high, no sea too rough, no Muff too tough. I’ve learned a lot of lessons in my life. Never shoot a large caliber man with a small caliber bullet. FLASH BURST IMAGES of all relevant equip, men being prepp M4s, night vision goggles, hand guns, knives, scopes chec Under Armor, PowerBars, water bottles, grenades, extra am radio's prepped, extra batteries, Laptops. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) (vo) I drive all kinds of trucks. 2x’'s, 4x's, 6x's even those big mother fuckers that bend and go TSSHITT TSSHITT when you step on the brakes. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 20 22. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) Anything in life worth doing is worth overdoing. Moderation is for cowards. DIETZ checking his radio equipment. AXE going over his infil map. LUTTRELL double checking all medical supplies. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) (vo) I'ma lover, I’m a fighter, I'ma UDT/SEAL Diver. I'll wine, dine, intertwine and then sneak out the back door when the refueling is done. MURPHY watching all of it. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) If your feeling froggy than you better jump because this Frogman has been there, done that and is going back for more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun setting over the Afghan desert. Thirty SEALs laying o the deck on their gear. Chilling out waiting for the 47's The guys laying around. Danny studies a piece of paper wi color tile samples printed on it.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Seems to me like you’ve got to straighten this shit out.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: There’s nothing to straighten out.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: If there’s nothing to straighten, why are you fighting?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We're not fighting?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Well, what is it that you’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: We're more like disagreeing.  23.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Disagreeing or arguing?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Probably more like mildly arguing. Just because you’re Mr. Perfect marriage, don’t be judging us mortal marriages who occasionally have mild disagreements, sometimes even loving arguments.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: It’s a fucking stupid loving argument.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It’s not an argument.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: It is an argument. Sounded like a couple of bighorn rams smashing skulls.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: What the fuck is everyone listening to my shit for?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Bro, you’re loud.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: You're louder than I am.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Just pick some tile and move the fuck on.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I picked the tile. She doesn’t like it.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: What does she fucking like?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (reading from paper) “Rose Honey Dew”

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Say what bro?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: She likes rose honey dew...something.  24.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: That’s what she likes.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You gotta control that situation.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Rose tiles in the kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Can we talk about something else?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Yea let’s talk about what she’s gonna tile your bathroom in.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna talk about that.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (Ron Burgandy impersonation) Danny? I’m gonna put it out there, if you like it, you can take it, if you don’t, send it right back. Dietz stares at Murphy. MURPHY (CONT’D) I wanna be on you.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I wanna be on you.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (pointing at Dietz) On you. Dietz smiles. Axe huge smile. Chopper engines grow louder. 47's back lit, coming in.

dialogues.speaker: HEALY
dialogues.text: Let’s pack it up The SEALs start gearing up. Tight on guys, stoic. Choppers land. SEALs muster up and start boarding.  21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to close up of Luttrell, back to real time. 24A. 21

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The choppers flying north into the setting sun, into the Hindu Kush. Chopper pilot POV, pushing deep into the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now approaching a steep hill top.

dialogues.speaker: CREW CHIEF
dialogues.text: (on radio) Good. Hold front, hold left, hold right, hold rear. The chopper is dangerously close to tree tops. Tucked int tiny opening.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on LUTTRELL. DIETZ. MURPHY. AXE The team ready to move, up and at the door, when... from cockpit.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: (on radio) Ropes. Ropes. Ropes. Fast rope dropped. Chopper jet engines screaming, the fou Opp SEALs up. The remaining twenty will be relocated and stand by as QRF. Axe up and out first, then Danny, Murphy out into the black night. Luttrell last one, hand on the rope, fist pounds Shane.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Next one Shane.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Have fun you lucky bastard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As the four SEALs drop fast, land smooth. Luttrell last. The Chopper pulls up fast and is gone in seconds leaving four SEALS alone in the dead quiet, pitch black. NIGHT goggles lowered. The four quickly spread and drop into a STOP. LOOK. LISTE  25A. SILENT.  25 26 26. SEALs breathing.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT VISION GOGGLES ON
dialogues.text: Silent. Wind and the faint howling of wolves. Dietz quietly keys his mic.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Apollo 22, Spartan 01.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The AC-130 banking 15,000 ft above the team.

dialogues.speaker: APOLLO RADIO MAN
dialogues.text: Spartan 01 Apollo 22, good comms. Were with you for six hours. Have a nice walk.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Apollo 22 Spartan 01 copy.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT VISION GREENS
dialogues.text: Tight on Murphy following Danny. Agile, despite the extra pounds of comm weight back-strapped. Luttrell - Foot down on loose granite. Pitch brutal. Left foot buckles. Slate shears. Falls. Slides. Flips. Lands o feet. He’s back on his feet. Axe pauses. Looks back smiling.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: (on radio) Having fun Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (on radio) You picked this route to torture us didn’t you?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: (on radio) Negative.

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I picked it to torture Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 27 28 27. Luttrell, too big for this pitch. Slips again.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I’m gonna kill you. A series of shots tracking the SEAL’s rough hike to their lookout. Axe leads navigating with his GPS. At each of the four waypoints, Danny radios pro words: Budweiser, Corona, Heineken.

dialogues.speaker: J-BAD TOC 26A
dialogues.text: Kristensen, Patton, Musselman and the QRF tracking the te movement across the mountain range. SEALs reach lookout destination late, the sun is up. Sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE.
dialogues.text: The team finally makes it to their planned observation sp Murphy is the first to have binoculars up and is looking hill, way down hill at the Afghan village. 2,000 ft., ver steep, cliff like. Below them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 100 stone and wood homes, well-constructed. Looks almost charming. A couple of dozen Afghan villagers in different parts of the village, kids playing, women cooking, two me working on a roof. Looks quite peaceful. Left: trying to see the rest of the village. Can’t get a view, a mountain is blocking his view. Danny has the radio out and is calling in the arrival pro word.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (on radio) Beastmaster, this is Spartan 01, radio check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the TOC, SGT HASSLERT takes the call from Dietz. Heavy static. Weak signal.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Spartan 01, this is Beastmaster. I have you weak but readable

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Beastmaster, this is Spartan 01. I pass Schlitz Malt liquor. How copy? Really weak signal.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Spartan 01 this is Beastmaster. Say again your last - you are weak and unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Beastmaster, this is Spartan 01. I pass Schlitz Malt Liquor, how copy.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Spartan 01, this is Beastmaster. Good copy. Hasslert looks to Kristensen. HASSLERT (CONT’D) Sketchy comms, sir. Spartan 01 has arrived. Erik Kristensen sitting. Nods. Gets up. Checks the wall clock: 6:45 AM

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Ok. He stretches, cracks his back, looks to a couple of SEALs manning the TOC.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Later fellas. Night, night. Track out the door with Kristensen, as he, Shane, and Hea step out of the TOC into the bright Afghan sunshine.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Glorious day. Kristensen and all but four SEALs head to the waiting 47' start boarding. Kristensen looks to Musslemen, a SEAL who is staying with QRF.  29 30 29.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: All yours brother.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: Roger that Skipper. Kristensen boards his 47 and the two choppers lift off heading back to Bagram. Two Blackhawks and two Apaches standing by on the tarmac.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Axelson and Luttrell together, spotting scopes out, they study the village.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Can’t see half the village.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea. They study the surrounding area.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s move down towards that peak, see if that’s not better.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Sounds good. Luttrell looks back at Axe and Dietz. He soft whistles an rolls his index finger, points down towards the peak belo them. Axe and Danny immediately get it. They start moving out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PETE MUSSLEMEN, one of the four SEALs left as part of the in J-Bad, walks into the TOC. Looks to Hasslert.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: Are we good?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Yes sir. They arrived about half hour ago. Should be digging in nice and tight right about now. Musslemen checks the clock on the J-Bad TOC.  31 30. Tight on clock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving, far from tucked in, over Murphy’s back as he move towards his new spot. Murphy, low crawling, gets close to the ledge. The four SEALs crawling out to the new lookout spot. Murp got his binoculars out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A perfect, clear, unobstructed view of the entire Afghan village.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We're good. Danny, on radio, trying to call in that they’ve relocated Can’t get through.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (to Murphy) No joy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Keep trying. As the team sets up, Dietz is looking up at the small mountain behind him that seems to be killing his radio. Series of shots: Murphy and Luttrell scopes up, start counting Taliban. At forty, Luttrell looks to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: That’s more than 10.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yes. Murphy is focused on a group of four men off to the side the village playing a game with stones. Seeing who can th the farthest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shah and Tarag with three soldiers playing stone throwing game. Laughing. Shah throws his stone. The men argue over threw further.

dialogues.speaker: HIDE
dialogues.text: Murphy locks his sight on Shah. Studying him.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus. Murphy hands the scope to Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Four guys on the right. Tall guy. Red scarf. No earlobes. Luttrell’s scope now trained on Shah. Luttrell and Murphy both checking wrist bands. Photo of S Clear match.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Bingo.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Do you have a shot?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Jesus Mickey, with this little 556? I’d need to stalk at least a 1000 yards closer.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Gotta call it in. Murphy turns to Dietz

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Can you make the fucking radio work? Dietz tries to call it in - no luck. Luttrell following Shah’s face with scope. Finger on trig

dialogues.speaker: VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Shah arguing with his soldiers over who threw further. Proclaims himself winner. Moves out of village into woods

dialogues.speaker: HIDE
dialogues.text: Luttrell’s POV:

dialogues.speaker: 30B.
dialogues.text: Shah disappears from sight. Murphy gets Axe’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Axe, stay put. Keep eyes on, we're gonna move back. Murphy, Luttrell and Dietz get up; moves away from the ri line, start building their hides.

dialogues.speaker: ABOVE THE RIDGELINE
dialogues.text: Marcus and Murphy talk as they work.  31.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: If we’re home by the 15th, me and Morgan are gonna cut down all the trees behind the stable.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How does that help me?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Brahms horse auction is, I think the 27th.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Is he selling Arabic horses? Kristensen says I should get her whatever Silver was.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Silver?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Hi-Ho Silver. Lone Ranger’s horse.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yea that’s a badass horse.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want a badass horse. She wants an Arabic horse.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Dude, how’s she going to know the difference. Get her a Quarter Horse, tell her it’s an Arabic. If she busts you, tell her if it’s good enough for the Lone Ranger...

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How much for an Arabic?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Probably around 15 grand.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Hell of a wedding present.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Is the redhead a bridesmaid?  31A.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: The redhead?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Melissa?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: The redhead from the Coldplay concert?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: That’s Melissa.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Is she coming?  32.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: She's a fucking bridesmaid.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I love her.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Get me a deal on the horse. I’11 get that done.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: That works. - Powerful scopes and cameras. - Luttrell and Axe draw detailed maps, diagrams, blueprin of every structure in the village. Luttrell photos Arab men with weapons moving through the town. CLEARLY A TALIBAN PRESENCE. - Dietz photographs windows, doors, detailed notes on hin wall thickness, structure, etc.. - Murphy taking the drawings, photoshopping them on a Toughbook computer. Dietz eats a PowerBar. Axe watches him.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Shouldn't eat that shit.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Toxic.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: You eat em...

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Never.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I've seen you eat PowerBars.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Never. I don’t eat shit bars.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Shit bars?  33.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Why you eating a shit bar? Dietz pauses. Pulls his eyes off his scope.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I’m eating it because I’m hungry.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Eat an apple.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I know what I’m eating.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Negative. Axe reading the list of ingredients commenting on each on

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I know exactly what I’m eating.

dialogues.speaker: LATER. 31B
dialogues.text: - Dietz sleeps. - Murphy eats an apple. - Axe up top on security. - Luttrell throws berries at a sleeping Dietz. - Axe studies the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ahmad Shah moving through village. Taraq and two him, all armed.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Danny your on, everybody else shut her down. - Luttrell, Axe, and Murphy settle in to sleep. 34A. men with  32 35. - Dietz, glasses up, studies the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sun getting higher. Low fog. Murphy, Axe, Luttrell sleep. Danny on watch. Wedged into a tree stump. ON DANNY. Tired but awake. Alert. Quietly singing to himself. TIGHT ON DANNY. His eyes a micro shift of focus. He still himself ever so slightly. DANNY’s POV He’s looking down hill. Wide gentle slope of the mountain leading to a sharper drop. The fire lights up the village below. Nothing moves. BACK to Danny. Eyes more focused. He slowly reaches down kills the iPod. Silence. Danny studies the hill with increasing focus. POV. Nothing moves. The three SEALs sleep. Tight on Luttrell. Sleeping. THEN a very faint sound from down hill. Silence. Then another. Luttrell slowly opens his eyes. Listening. Another sound, a soft bell. Marcus shifts, looks down hill. Marcus's POV Looking down hill. Nothing moving. The sounds becoming mo present. Bells. Tight on Luttrell. Looking.  36.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The empty hill. More Bells. Then cresting the hill. First just the tips of the ears. Then the forehead, nose, face. A large male goat. Bell ringing gently from his neck.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON MARCUS
dialogues.text: Studying the goat. As another goat appears. Then another...then another...th twenty... A herd of goats moving up the hill right at them. Marcus is wide awake, eyes scanning the hill scanning the goats when... A human head crests the hill. A young Afghan BOY, ten yea old. Luttrell reaches for his Mark 12, looks over to Axe still sleeping. Then to Murph still sleeping. Then back to Dann Danny’s already on scope. Gun aimed at the approaching ki when... Two more Afghan MEN crest the hill - an old man and a teenager. The hill is full of goats. More than a hundred with the t Afghans moving straight at the SEALs. The goat bells and baying of the animals creating serious noise. Murph and Axe both waking up. Weapons coming up as they silently take in this bizarre situation. Back to Marcus as the first goat passes by. Then another. Tight on lead Afghan boy...THE GOAT BOY. He’s heading dangerously close to Luttrell’s hide singing quietly to himself. Tight on Luttrell. Gun up and trained on the goat boy as gets closer...closer...and then in a one in a million...t fucking goat boy takes one more step and comes down squar Luttrell’s head.  33 34 37. Luttrell moves, the kid screams, Luttrell’s up, gun up...screaming.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Get the fuck down. Axe, Danny, and Murphy. Guns up moving in fast on the terrified goat men...

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Down Down Down. The kid screams and starts running downhill towards the village. AXE sprints on him fast, takes the kid down, han over mouth. Kid bites and struggles wild. Goats running in fear as the three Afghans are roughly th down. Searched, a military style Motorola walkie talkie t from the old man, flex-cuffed and gagged... When it’s done the four SEALs stand over them. Murphy loo at Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck. Murphy looks to Dietz. MURPHY (CONT’D) (re: radio) Can you get a call out or what? Dietz reaches for his radio.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the radio room. Musselman and Comms guys by their radi SILENT. Clearly Spartan 01 is not getting through.

dialogues.speaker: BACK ON THE MOUNTAIN 34
dialogues.text: The goats spread out, grazing, bells ringing loud. a larg dog, mouth foaming, growls and bark at the team. Luttrell raises his Mark 12 at the dog when it gets too close. Murphy is trying to interrogate the older man with a translation box. He speaks into it and it’s supposed to translate into Pashto.  35 38. They have separated the older man from the boys. Murphy a Luttrell have them off to the side.. Axe stands watch ove the boy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (speaking into the Phrase- O-Later) Are you looking for Americans? A robotic-like voice used for making out the question in Arabic. The old man stares at Murphy with a combination of hatred confusion.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do the Taliban know we are up here? Death stare from the old man. Murphy getting frustrated. Louder.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Do they know? The old man stares, finally says something quiet. Too qui for the translating machine. Murphy puts the mic closer.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Say again. Are you Taliban? The old man rants on as the machine struggles to translat his slang Pashtun.

dialogues.speaker: TRANSLATION MACHINE
dialogues.text: Do not drink with many blood rooms fire and knives...

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: This fuckin thing’s not working... The machine starts translating what Murphy is saying.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Shut the fuck up ! Murphy throws the machine on the ground. The dog makes another move at Luttrell. Fangs mashing. Luttrell raises his gun. The dog backs down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny continues to try his radio.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Spartan 01, Spartan base...Spartan 01, Spartan base... Nothing. Murphy standing just off the group calls Luttrell over.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Marcus. Leaving Axe on security. Luttrell moves up the hill fifty feet with Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Murphy’s God Awful law. Not you Mikey. The other prick. The God of screw-ups.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Soft Compromise bro.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea. I’m aware of that. Murphy digs into his pack, pulls out his SATELLITE PHONE. Checks numbers on his wrist pad. Dials up J-Bad TOC (Comm Center).

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (a touch frustrated: to Dietz) I’m now going to be that guy calling on a fucking unsecure Sat line because your radio is not functioning.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Move that mountain, we’re good. Talk to the mountain, sir.  37 40. Loses the signal twice. Third try he gets through. Horrible connection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A phone rings, answered by a young Marine, SGT. HASSLERT.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: J-Bad TOC, SERGEANT HASSLERT.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Sergeant can you hear me, this is Spartan 01, can you here me? Horrible delays, echoes and static.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: This is Spartan 01, do you hear me?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: I hear you.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: This is not a secure line and I need to speak to the CO immediately.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: The CO?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: That’s correct.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Which CO sir?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Commander Kristensen.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Commander Kristensen is not here sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What do you mean he’s not there?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Commander Kristensen left this morning.  Murphy realizing he’s made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Right. Fuck. He’s back at BAGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: That’s correct sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Hello?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I‘m here, I need to speak right now with the commander.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Commander is in BAGRAM.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I know that can you please transfer this call to BAGRAM OUELLETTE TOC.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Roger that. Stand by.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Standing by. 4l. Silence Murphy looks down at the goat herders. Moves over Danny with the radio. Holding up his SAT phone. MURPHY (CONT’D) (re: SAT phone) Handing them our goddamned position. Tight on Murphy, the realization of how fucked they are i starting to settle in.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What’s the fucking problem?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Does it need new fucking batteries?  42.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No, it’s fine but they won’t fucking answer me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It’s quiet. Among the SEALs present: Patton, James Suh, D Healy. A phone in the SEAL TOC rings answered by PATTON

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Ouellette TOC Petty Officer Patton..

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Patton, this is Murphy. Really Bad connection.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: You're looking for Mike Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: This is Mike Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Mike Murphy?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yes correct, this is Mike Murphy. A horrible connection. Patton is confused. He knows that Murphy and his team are deep on their opp.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Is this Shane?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: It’s Shane. What’s up Mike? This connection sucks.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Are you not receiving our transmissions?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Radio calls? Not in a while. Patton yells over to the Comms guys.  43. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D) Are you all hearing anything from SPARTAN 1.

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: When? We've been communicating.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: (back on the phone) They say they are communicating with you.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Say again.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Comms says that you are good. Copy?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: In the last twenty minutes?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: (back to comms guy) You talked in the last twenty minutes?

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: (into phone) Negative Murph.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I need the skipper now.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: He’s sleeping sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Wake him up now. Murphy’s voice is electronically garbled.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Did you say wake him up sir?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Right the fuck now!

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Roger that.  39

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SHANE PATTON barefooted jogs out of the TOC moves through series of plywood barracks. Knocks on a door.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Skipper. Skipper. He knocks harder. SHANE PATTON (CONT’D)

dialogues.speaker: SKIPPER
dialogues.text: From inside.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: (oc) What?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Sir sorry sir. I’ve got Lieutenant Murphy on the phone in the TOC. Says he needs to talk to you. Now. A moment, then Kristensen’s door flies open. Kristensen i his underwear, flip flops, moving out, clearly just wakin up. Track with them as Kristensen moves back into the TOC. 39 Reaches for the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: (into phone) Mike? Silence Static.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Mike...? Mike...? Try him back. PATTON reads Murphy’s SAT phone number off the board. Dials. Waits. Nothing. Tries again nothing.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Is it dead?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: What‘d he want?  40 45.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: No idea sir.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Did he say anything?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Just that he needed to speak to you.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Anything wrong?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Didn't say sir. Stay with Kristensen a bit concerned. Looking at the map the Valley.

dialogues.speaker: TIGHT ON KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Thinking.....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy trying his IRIDIUM SAT phone one more time.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Can someone explain to me why they both crash at the same time?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL AXE
dialogues.text: Murphy’s law. Murphy’s law Now a last resort. Murphy keys his personal radio. An MBI walkie talkie mounted on the side of his chest. MURPHY (CONT’D) Spartan 01 to anyone. Spartan 01 to anyone listening. Over.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We could light these goats on fire and smoke signal our way out of here.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I could go down to the village and ask to borrow a phone. Murphy just stares at the goat herders.  46.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (quietly to himself) Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You'd get some interesting tile ideas down there bro. Afghan Dirt Brown. Goat skin blond, she’ll dig that a hell of a lot more than what is it Honey creme...? The goat noise is now really loud. Dogs barking and Axe i getting focused. Doing the math. The kid bolts. Hands cuffed behind his back, he’s still f as shit.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Fuck me. He charges again after the kid. Tackles him. Drags him ba AXE breathing hard. Looking at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I'm thinking three ways this plays out. All eyes on Murphy. His brain churning.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We let em go, we’re gonna fight. So we can 1) Tie em up. Move out. Probably take them 15 minutes to get out. 2) Let em go. We hike out. Roll dice.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Three?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Three, soft Compromise. Terminate the compromise. Axe stares at Murphy. Third choice is obvious. Murphy looks up to the mountain top a mile behind them.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Can we get a signal from that mountain?  47.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I thought about that. Probably. I don't fucking know. More dog barking, goat baying, bells ringing. The kids ar staring rage into the eyes of the Americans.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We gotta do something boss.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea. Murphy walks back down to Luttrell and Axe.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: They don’t seem to like us very much.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea. A pause. Reality setting in.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Shah’s down there. We let them go, Shaw disappears. Mission fails.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What? Kill them. Axe stares at Murphy. Murphy staring at Axe. Realizing how serious he is.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: We are compromised Mike. Marcus spits out some chew. Looking down, he shakes his h A pained grin plasters his face.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Danny? Danny takes a long look at the goat herders. Finally...

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I don’t give a shit what you decide. I’m not a lawyer. Just tell me what to do Murph. You're the big bucks, earn em’. Murphy turns to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know Mikey. Luttrell takes his time. The goats sound like they are howling. The vibe on the mountain is becoming deathly serious.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I don’t know. I don’t like it. We kill them. Yea ok. We kill them. Bury them. They get found. Then what...

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Then what?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I’m just saying. It ain’t gonna be private. Gonna be out there for the whole fucking world. CNN -- SEALs kill goat farmers. I don’t want that legacy, bro. I’m not killing goat farmers. Not feeling that.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I’m not either, but the Old man’s Tali and these kids can shoot better than you can.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Let’s just tie ‘em up and get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: We tie them up, we have no control over when they get found; get free. I will die before I let them dictate when we die. I will not end up showing your body -- your head -- on television. On the Computer. No way, they do not get that vote.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Then let’s just get the fuck out of here.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I will do this, I will kill them right now. They will not harm you or me or my wife or your wife or any of our unborn children. No. These people are death and I will not fucking bow to this.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: You want to kill, Axe? Really? That’s your position?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I want to be playing golf with Freddie Couples on Pebble Beach, but I’m having a little trouble getting a tee time.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: If we kill these kids, it’s International news. CNN doesn’t care about Rules of Engagement. SEALs kill kids. That’s the story. Forever. Tight on the guys taking this in. Murphy paces, staring intensely at one of the goat kids.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Axe what’s your call?  49A. Axe stares at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: (sad grin) My final answer?  50.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Your final answer.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Kill them. This hits hard.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Danny? Dietz stares at the tied up kids.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: It’s your call bro.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: You don’t have an opinion?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Yea I have an opinion. Two opinions. One is that for the record I don’t give a fuck what anyone thinks about what the fuck we do up here. We do what we do. What we have to do. That’s it. That’s our business.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: What’s two?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Two is, this is the Navy and you’re the boss and your job is to be the boss and my job is to do what I’m fucking told.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: So you tell me what to do and it will be done. Murphy looks to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Marcus what’s your call? Luttrell seems to get that with Danny out, Murphy’s for letting them go, Axe wants them dead - he’s the tie-break  51.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: (slowly shaking his head) No. I'd rather fight them straight up. I don’t want to kill these kids. ON MURPHY. Thinking. He looks around the area. Looking for a burial spot. Stabbing at the stone earth with his M4. Clearly no soft earth anywhere close.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (quiet) Fuck me. Murphy stares down at the Afghan village. Then long and h at the three Afghans. Finally turns back to goat herders.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Look at them. They fucking hate us. We don’t know how many Hajji’s they have down there. We can’t let them go.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: So now you have an opinion? I thought you were standing by waiting for your orders?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: This opp is a soup sandwich. Been so from the beginning. The pitch. The rope. Worst comms that I’ve ever seen. Soft intel, we are not wearing vests, have no heavy weapons, are weak in numbers.... It’s a cursed opp.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Starting to feel like a cursed opp.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: It’s not a cursed opp. There are no fucking curses. Just Afghanistan. That’s all. Everyday man. Devil’s asshole.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Shah just killed twenty marines last week and we’re on him. We’ve come this far and these people here are him. They are a part of him. We let them go. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We're letting him go and why in the fucking world does he have the right to do that to us? Axe is starring at LUTTRELL.  Silence. 52. AXE. Seriously Marcus. Why does he have the right to do that to us?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t see it that way.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: So what is your fucking call bro?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Let them go. Shut it down. So if Murphy was taking a vote it seems like it’s one vot for killing them, one vote for letting them go, Danny is neutral. This is all on MURPHY. Murphy turns away from them, looking down the steep pitch mountain. The village far below. Murphy thinks. Looks at the young kids. The old man.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Here’s what we’re gonna do. Pack up. Everything. We’re gonna let ‘em go and we’re gonna make the peak. When we make the peak were gonna make Comms. We’re calling QRF and we're getting out. Silence as the guys take in the plan. Luttrell lets out a huge breath.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: That’s what we’re going to do.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Let’s move it. Quick Shots. The guys quickly breaking down their gear. The goat boy watching confused.  52A. The older Goat herders. Defiant. Steel-eyed.  41 42 53.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristensen, Patton with Petty Officer Dan Healy, James Su and some COMMS guys. The Comms guys trying to get Spartan 01 back on line.

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: Spartan 01, Spartan 01, over. Kristensen is on the phone, communicating with J-Bad TOC

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: When was your last contact with Spartan 01?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Blackhawks standing by with the two Apaches. The Apache pilots are firing up their engines. Musslemen comes out of a pilot station.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: Where are you guys going?

dialogues.speaker: APACHE PILOT
dialogues.text: We just got called North. By an Army 372, evidently they took some small fire.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: We’re QRF, bro.

dialogues.speaker: APACHE PILOT
dialogues.text: That’s what we thought. BAGRAM is now QRF.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: The 47s?

dialogues.speaker: APACHE PILOT
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: Are we not the QRF now?

dialogues.speaker: APACHE PILOT
dialogues.text: That’s my understanding. Mussleman is a bit confused...  43
Apache pilots climb into their two birds. Take off.

dialogues.speaker: MINUTES LATER
dialogues.text: Gear packed the four SEALs stand over the Afghans. MURPHY CONT’D Everybody good? Quick nods from the team as Murphy’s flip knife comes out quickly cuts through the flex cuffs. Freeing the Afghans.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: You three just won the lottery. Speak well of us. An odd moment as the Afghans stare at the SEALs. Not full understanding that they are free to leave.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Go! The little goat boy stares at Murphy. A beat then gets it Turning fast he takes off sprinting down the hill. The old man holds a beat. Says something quietly to the t Sounds fairly ominous. Then he too turns and slowly, deliberately starts making way down the long steep mountain. Murphy looks at the team.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Let’s move it. The four SEALs, full gear, start moving up the mountain. There is no trail. Just steep rocks, fallen trees, and a brutal pitch.
Leaping over rocks. Fallen trees. The kid’s movements are beautiful. Mountain agility in his DNA. Virtually FLYING the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: UP TOP. 43B
dialogues.text: Slow going for the SEALs. Murphy leading. Danny, loaded u with COMMS, second. Luttrell breathing hard. Axe bringing the rear. On AXE Constantly checking behind him. His left foot catches on some loose granite. Gives out. Axe rolls his ankle hard. Slips, falls hard sliding fast tumbling and smashing hard into a fallen tree stump. Sprained right ankle and bruised left ribs. Murphy stops, looking back as Luttrell moves down to Axe. Axe struggling back on his feet. LUTTRELL. You ok?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Fucking Afghanistan. LUTTRELL. Yea. I’m the one who’s supposed to be falling.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I’m fine. He takes a step. White flash of burst pain tears through He buckles. Clearly not alright.

dialogues.speaker: THE GOAT KID 43C
dialogues.text: Running hard approaching the village.

dialogues.speaker: UP TOP. 43D
dialogues.text: Luttrell reaches for him. Axe pulls away.

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m good. Let’s go. Axe digs his foot in. Grinds through the pain and starts up the hill.  44 45 56.

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Maybe we should just hike down to the village, ask to borrow a phone. Tight on Murphy’s small smile as he digs it up the hill. The group now moving even slower cause of Axe’s ankle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet. A couple of small fires. Some cooking. A group of young boys playing with sticks. Women cooking as - The yo GOAT BOY comes tearing, full sprint into the village. TIGHT ON THE GOAT BOY. Eyes wide. Screaming for Shah. Villagers start to gather. Shah approaches the boys. Breathing hard, they point up the mountain. A couple of Taliban hear this. Take off into the woods. TRACKING with the two Taliban. As they sprint deeper into the woods. Into the Taliban ca Taliban soldiers sleeping. The two find Shah and Taraq. T them about the Americans. Shah quickly on his walkie talkie, old school but deathly effective. Rounding up his fighters. Quick shots of the Taliban army. Feels like 150 men. Armi themselves. AK’s, RPG's, grenades, a lot of ammo. Radio g Quiet, cool, professional. These Afghan soldiers are load up big time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SEALs cresting the hill.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck. He’s looking up at a larger hill in front of them. They h just ascended a false summit. Still blocked in by another very steep mountain.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Danny?  46 57. Dietz is already into the radio, as Luttrell and Axe spre out, digging in, guns pointed down hill.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (on radio) Anvil 1 this is Spartan 01, over. Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Great. Comms still clearly dead. Murphy weighing his options. Th are high above the village. Murphy pulls out binoculars. Scanning the village and mountain. All three SEALs on glass. SCANNING.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing moving. From their vantage the town seems quiet. Business as usual. They cannot see the Taliban off in the woods. They are OBLIVIOUS to the magnitude of the threat.

dialogues.speaker: TWENTY MINUTES LATER. 46
dialogues.text: Danny still working the radio. Axe has tightened his boot Murphy and Luttrell have spread out on the hill. Staring at the village. Murphy’s got his SAT phone out. Trying to get a signal. Can't. He’s looking with disgust at the mountain behind him, kno that it’s blocking his signal.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (to mountain) Move Bitch. Luttrell’s fifteen feet to his left.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: What do you want to do?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Go home, get in bed, and watch Anchorman.  58.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Check.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I wanna be on you.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Roger that. Should I spread the word?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Not just yet. Let’s hold up for an hour and see just how big of a can of hell we’ve opened.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: What do you think?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We did the right thing. We let our love light shine. God ought to be smiling down on us. Isn’t that how it works? Good things happen to good people?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You think they’re coming after us?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Like a pack of wild dogs. MURPHY keys his radio.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What say you Axe?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: (on radio) I’m fine. Murphy looks up behind him to the large cliff.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (to Axe) You good to go?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: No problems boss.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Here’s the deal. Lay low here. Soon as the sun sets we move. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: If we can’t get comms from that top we're probably gonna have to walk home anyway, so get some rest. Axe you're first security. We move in about sixty minutes.

dialogues.speaker: THIRTY MINUTES LATER. 46A
dialogues.text: Murphy, Danny, and Marcus. Hats low. Eyes closed. Danny o the glass. It’s quiet. Sun getting low. Probably two hours of sunlig left. ON AXE. Calmly checking down hill, whistling very quietly to hims Tight on Luttrell resting. Danny. Eyes closed. One arm around his radio. Murphy. Eyes open. Staring up at the sky. Back to Axe. Focused down range. Down the mountain. Something appears to move. Axe misses Hold a beat. More movement. Just catches Axe’s peripheral... Axe shifts his gaze. Focusing.

dialogues.speaker: THEN
dialogues.text: More movement. Axe sees it, raises his gun eye to the sco Gently scanning the area of movement. Stops whistling. AXE’S POV: No movement. Axe slowly pans his M-4 across the hill. Suddenly A FLASH SOMETHING HUMAN. A HUMAN. He pans a bit more to the right. Then two more. AXE pans way to the right. Almost as high as the SEALs ar and he see’s more movement. They are almost surrounded. TIGHT ON LUTTRELL eyes still closed.  60.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (oc) Sssst! Sssst! Luttrell lifts up his hat and looks left. Sees Axe, rigid, in firing position, his rifle aimed stra up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (to Danny) Try and call it in. Danny desperate to get the radio to work. Luttrell fixes his Mark 12 into firing position looks thr scope down hill. LUTTRELL’S POV. Lined along the top are at least a dozen heavily armed Taliban warriors, each one of them with an AK pointing downward. Some carrying rocket propelled grenades. LUTTRELL looks left. More Taliban coming down hill to flank them. Luttrell looks right. More Taliban. The SEALS are FUCKED.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: How the fuck fast are these little bastards? All four SEALs guns up. Marcus in the middle, Axe and Danny up to his left. Murph twenty feet off to his right. Marcus slowly belly crawls towards Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What are you thinking?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I’m thinking that we’re about fixing to get into a pretty good gunfight.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea.  61.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Looks like I voted wrong.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Negative. We’ve been given the opportunity to reach out and make some hell fucking strong contact with our friends from the other side. Job well done.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Hoo-yah to that sir.

dialogues.speaker: ON DANNY AND AXE
dialogues.text: Looking up the hill which is now swarming with Taliban. Dozens of soldiers flowing down hill flanking them.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Do they see us?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Dunno. BACK TO MARCUS. His back pressed up against a tree, inventorying his ammo Grenades. Knife. Danny, Axe, Murphy all doing the same. Readying for war. Axe and Danny sneak quick looks at the pictures of their wives taped inside their helmets. The trap tightening around all of them. All four focused hill. A TREE TWENTY FEET IN FRONT OF MARCUS. A flash of a turban. Glint of an AK Barrel pointed in his general direction. Luttrell tightens the grip of his rifle slowly starts pointing it in the direction of the man behind the tree. Luttrell eyes on glass, still as marble. Aimed at the tre Marcus looks over his shoulder at Murphy whose gun is als trained on the tree. Marcus eyes back on the scope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A fierce-eyed Taliban warrior peering straight into the scope. Black eyes and thick black beard. The barrel of hi pointed dead on Luttrell. Hold. THEN. Luttrell fires once. Blowing the man’s head off. An odd brief moment of silence as the head shot Afghan stumbles, still standing, still clutching his AK-47. He t three more steps towards Luttrell. Stops. Luttrell shoots again removes what's left of the fighter’ head. The Afghan starts to fall and as he hits the ground, all BREAKS LOOSE. From above and half way down both flanks the Taliban open fire.
