Screaming at each other, communicating through violent, l bursts of Pashto, the Taliban moving fast down the hill. Agile and fearless, not weighted down with US-style gear, they are able to leap boulders, fallen trees. Taraq in the middle of the pack on the top of the SEALs. TOP - Shah calmly giving orders into his radio comms. ON MURPHY. Taliban moving down the hill on both sides. Shooting as t move. A solid line of at least fifty Taliban in firing position top of the hill above them. The SEALs are close to being surrounded. MURPHY checks his rear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A cliff. More of a series of cliffs. Multiple death falls First one is at least 300 feet. Murphy calls it.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Push right flank.  63. Axe the farthest right starts shooting and moving right I the wall of the Taliban flanking his right. Luttrell follows staying low, shooting, Danny firing with arm. Desperate to get the radio up.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Spartan 01 reporting major enemy contact. We need help. Spartan 01 reporting major enemy contact. Request immediate QRF! Spartan 01 requesting immediate ORF. Murphy’s doing the same with his SAT phone. He’s moving r trying to dial up the TOC. Not getting through. Danny’s left two fingers HIT. Dangling bloody and mangled He tries to put them back into his hand. Jams his ring fi back into its socket. His pinkie is beyond repair.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus! Luttrell turns, Danny holds up his fucked up hand.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Wrap it up bro.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Roger that. Taliban gunfire is picking up. Axe the deepest right kill two Taliban. Two more immediately fill their positions.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Danny did you get the call through?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: I made the call. Don’t know if it went through. You?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I couldn't get a line.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Fuck. Marcus is pushing right behind Axe trying to break the ri Taliban flank. Charging the Ambush.  64.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Keep pushing right. Kill ‘em all. The four SEALs fighting well as a team. Crawling, shootin and covering as they start making progress killing their into the right side of the Taliban ambush. The Taliban close enough to see clearly. Axe shot through the left shoulder. Ignoring it he keeps firing. His long scope making him very accurate. As he sh deep into the left flank.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From behind at least 12 Tabliban fighters pushing deeper the right side. Two more Taliban hit. The remaining start taking solid covering positions, firing down at the four SEALs. Axe being the closest takes the majority of the firepower Decent cover from a granite boulder which is getting hack to pieces by the incoming AK fire. Razor sharp stone shrapnel chunks slicing into Axe’s face neck. Blood runs down his face drips off his chin. Luttrell getting equally shot up. Returning fire. His cov rock getting shot up bad. Chunks of granite tearing into face and neck. FURTHER to the left, Danny and Murphy shooting, trying to closer to Luttrell and Axe. Danny takes another round, blowing clear through his righ thigh shattering his right femur. Blood, muscle chunks an bone tear through his pants.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Goddammitt. Pissed he keeps moving. Firing. Ignoring his two gunshots Hand and Leg. Danny moves up with Murphy behind some decent cover.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Can you fight?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Roger that.  65.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Want me to take the radio?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Negative. Murphy looks up towards Axe who is far right.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (yelling)

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Sir!

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Can we break that flank? Hold this, we’re gonna push left! Axe gets shot through the top of his shoulder the bullet tearing down through his shoulder and burning deep inside chest. Axe keeps firing, hitting a Taliban in the knee. The Tali fires back at Axe missing but sending sharp rock chips shearing up off the granite into Axe’s face. Shredding hi right ear, cutting into his eyeballs. Half blind. Watery out of focus images as sweat mixed wit blood. Axe struggles to see. When his vision clears up en to focus: AXE POV. Two Tali fighters. Moving fast out of cover, right at AXE Directly at the Americans. SEAL style. Attacking the coun attack. The Taliban are close to the half blind Axe. Axe fires bl Misses. The Taliban almost on him. Then: One of the Tali hit with a round from Luttrell, killed. T other, wounded, falls on Axe. Vicious hand-to-hand fight. Luttrell runs up to help Axe. Takes the remaining Taliban soldier out with a point-blank headshot. From the right, a BELT FED MACHINE GUN opens up on their position. Marcus and Axe start moving left. Both shot during the mo Marcus in his right butt-cheek, Axe in his right thigh.  65A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Comms guy at radio. Checking wall clock. See’s Kristensen Shane, and some of the other Team 10 guys.

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: Spartan 01 is about to miss a comms second window.  66.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: How long?

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: 2 hours 15 minutes. Tight on Kristensen. Thinking. Checking the clock.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Call me if they miss two.

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: CHAOS.
dialogues.text: A massive barrage of gunfire erupting from the right Tali flank.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Right is no good. Murphy looks left. He can see twenty Taliban moving into firing positions.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck me. The first RPG comes from the left side. Hitting just shor Danny and Murphy. Blasting them backwards. Covering them dirt and rock. Luttrell swings his gun left and starts firing into the l Taliban position.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Mikey?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You ok?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We're good. A bullet slams in Murphy’s lower stomach. MURPHY (CONT’D) This is no good.  67.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Can we break that right flank?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Negative. We got to go left.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Negative. From downhill, two RPG’s fire at their position. Dietz takes a shot in his upper-right chest. A massive double RPG explosion. Tears away chunks of gran Shrapnel cutting deep into all four SEALs. They are now clearly under attack from all three sides.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We can take ‘em Mikey but I’m thinking we’re gonna need a new spot. Tight on Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Roger that. He turns behind him giving that 50 ft. cliff a second loo The Taliban gunfire is relentless now. Coming from all th sides. Luttrell, Danny and Axe returning constant fire. Reloadin mags. Firing away. Marcus hit for the first time in his r ass cheek. Tight on Murphy: MURPHY (CONT’D) We gotta fall back. Luttrell looks at the cliff behind them.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You mean fall off.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Roger that. Fall off. Danny can you move?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Axe?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Good to go. As the four shot up SEALs turn and start to move fast tow the edge of the cliff. The pitch causing them to run and start falling immediately. Danny’s legs giving out, buckl as he hurls himself up and over the ledge. Marcus turns to Murphy. Luttrell, Murphy and Axe do the same. For a second they l like four country boys cliff jumping into a lake. Except the blood streaming from necks and guts and legs, the bul tracers flying all around them... They fly off the cliff and it looks kind of beautiful. Freeing...until.

dialogues.speaker: IMPACT. BOTTOM OF 1ST CLIFF 48A
dialogues.text: Bone crushing. Concussive. Violent beyond words. Human bo smashing into rock. Tearing through trees. Bouncing. Brok bones and smashed faces. Helmets fly off. The SEALs crash bounce and flip. Finally settling hard on a reasonably fl part of the cliff. 300 yards below.

dialogues.speaker: SILENCE. BOTTOM OF 1ST CLIFF 48B
dialogues.text: Tight on Luttrell. Face down. The first to move. Face lifts. Nose clearly broken. Luttrell looks to his le Murphy struggling to his knees. Broken teeth. Face shredd To the right, Danny and Axe.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Hey Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: That sucked.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I mean that really sucked.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Voices screaming up the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: TOP OF 1ST CLIFF 48C
dialogues.text: Taraq is at the jump point looking down the steep cliff. Feels unsurvivable. Several fierce lieutenants flanking S

dialogues.speaker: SHAH
dialogues.text: Go. Dozens of Taliban start making their way down the steep cliff.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE BOTTOM OF 1ST CLIFF 48D
dialogues.text: Murphy, Marcus Axe and Dietz struggling to their feet.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck. Luttrell sees the blood pouring from Murphy’s gut.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Let me see it. Pulling up Murphy’s shirt revealing a decent gut shot. Ma looks for his med kit. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Lost my med kit.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Where’s your gun? Luttrell looks down. To his left, then right. Spots his g ten feet away in the dirt.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: God's looking out for us.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: If this is looking out for us I don’t want to see him pissed.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We're doing good Mikey we just gotta... Luttrell interrupted by a series of severe incoming RPG's Blasting all around them. Luttrell and Murphy dive behind some fallen trees. Lookin up.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We just got to get off this hill.

dialogues.speaker: HALFWAY DOWN 1ST CLIFF. 48E
dialogues.text: Shah's Taliban are slowly moving down the cliff. Not near as fast as the SEALs fall. But they are definitely coming ON LUTTRELL and MURPHY. LOG HIDE. 48F Returning fire. Picking off a couple of Taliban but revea their position. More incoming RPG’s tearing into the cove trees. Trees start burning. A metal hook - RPG debris - spears into Luttrell’s right side. He keeps firing when from the left... A LOUD CRASHING. Two bodies falling hard. Axe and Danny. Falling hard like Murphy and Luttrell. Sianming, flipping, landing 50 ft to the right of the tre Axe shot up getting to his feet. The Taliban shooting dow him. MURPHY (CONT’D) Axe! Here! Move it buddy. Run! Axe sees Murphy behind the trees. Charges to the hide.  71.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: This sucks. No hesitation - Axe slams a fresh magazine into his M4 st firing up the hill. Marcus is looking back to Danny. Danny is dead still. No movement. Axe provides cover as Luttrell and Murphy, dodging RPG’s a hailstorm of AK fire, grabbing an alive but seriously fucked up Danny. Picking Danny up they start hauling him back to the tree cover. TIGHT on Danny as a Bullet slams through his right rib ca

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (eyes tight, through mashed teeth) Goddamn this sucks. Luttrell and Murphy slam into the tree hide propping Dann up. The four SEALs back together ready to fight. Marcus tryin to treat Danny; pulling out his Burst Kit Danny recovering staring down at his blood-soaked hand, dazed, looks to Marcus

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus, I’m shot.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We are all shot bro, can you fight? Danny stares back down at his bleeding, mangled hand, the his gun.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: (muttering to himself) Mess up my drawing hand, that pisses me off. Danny raises his gun uphill, takes aim at a Taliban fight jumping from rock to rock. Danny fires killing the Taliba Re-aims, fires, kills a second. Re-aims, fires, kills a third. Looks to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I can fight.
The SEALS now packed into a burning LOG HIDE fighting as as they can from inferior position.

dialogues.speaker: UP HILL. 48G
dialogues.text: Taliban starting to re-mass. Dialing in on the SEALs position. Thirty AK-47's firing down on the SEALs.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE LOG HIDE. 48H
dialogues.text: The SEALs getting sprayed. A ceiling of AK fire. The SEAL flat on their backs. SEAL POV. AK tracers streak over head. MURPHY has his face next to Dietz.

dialogues.speaker: DANNY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I tried ‘em at least three times boss.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Nothing?

dialogues.speaker: DANNY
dialogues.text: Nothing. Murphy and Dietz both take rounds. Danny in the foot. Three of Murphy’s right toes blow off. His boot leaking blood. Murphy returning fire. Hot brass shell casings falling in his shirt.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Dammit! Murphy getting the brass out of his shirt. MURPHY (CONT’D) Goddamnitt! Danny screaming in pain. Eyes pouring tears.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Danny?  73.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: This really sucks man. Really fucking sucks. Fucking burning inside bro. Axe and Luttrell trying to fire over the logs. Luttrell h a grenade. Taliban with RPG’s moving into firing position.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: We gotta move! As the first RPG blows into the side of the log hide. Wood daggers and burning embers explode and rip through clothes and skin.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Move left! Left! Axe and Luttrell start moving out. Dietz struggling to get up, radio pulling him backwards. Murphy reaches back for Dietz. MURPHY (CONT’D) Give me a hand Danny. Danny dazed stares up at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come on buddy! We got to move. A second RPG demolishes the hide. Fully exposing Murphy a Dietz. Murphy yanks Dietz to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Right now bro.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: I’m with you. Murphy fires up the hill.  487 74. Dietz grinds it out following Luttrell. Murphy lays out more cover fire, then turns and moves aft the three SEALs. SIDE OF MOUNTAIN. Ravine. 487 Tight shots of the four SEALs scrambling for their lives. Bleeding, spit, sweat, snot, tears as they claw their way across the burning mountain. This is a sequence. Watching the men run. Legs buckling. caps smashing on rock. Slipping falling helping each othe Incoming rounds tearing past them. Daytime trace fire. The SEALs charge across the side of the mountain. Breathing is hysteric. High-pitched wheezing and gagging. They are literally running cross a burning mountain for t lives. Luttrell first to stop. Tight on Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Gotta fucking rest. Axe collapses next to him, then Murphy, then Dietz. All f SEALs gasping and choking for air. A moment of desperate attempts to get air.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Need some water.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We got to get to the village. Got to.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Got to.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck. Dietz is by far the worst. Trying to breath. Blood loss starting to weaken him. Murphy pulls out his sat phone, tries to get a signal.  49 50 75. Tight on Each SEAL. Burning. Sucking air. Luttrell stares Dietz. Hold this for a couple of beats. A brief silence. A pause

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: This is bad....

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristensen watching clock. Drinking coffee.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: That’s the second window.

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: Correct. Clear tension in the TOC. A half dozen SEALs gathered in the TOC. Kristensen picks up phone. Dials the large force special TOC (Base control) Intercut with Kristensen and CO of JOC. Kristensen lettin know that he’s missed two windows of contact with Spartan

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back tight on four SEALs. Still silent, trying to recover Then. Sounds of the Taliban yelling. Communicating as they star get closer. Luttrell looks over to Dietz. Whispering.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: How you feeling Danny?

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Shot me up pretty good bro.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You’re good Danny. Axe, Murphy, Luttrell, counting mags and grenades. Trying to compose themselves. Luttrell packing dirt into Danny’s gun shot wounds.

Looks back to Murphy. Everyone whispering. Trying to stay as quiet as possible. Taliban has lost them. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Pack ‘em with dirt. Tight. Murphy literally balling up dirt and jamming it into his guts. Trying to plug the blood flow.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF ABOVE ROCK QUARRY 50A
dialogues.text: With Taraq and his men as they move through the mountain. Searching for the SEALs. SEALs HIDING IN ROCK QUARRY 50B Dead quiet. Alert. Luttrell moves Axe checking his wounds. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) You're okay. Danny blurts out. Loud voice.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: How'd they get on us so fast Mikey? Murphy and Axe on him. Hands around his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Shhhhhh. Danny Shhhhhh. Silence. The SEALs wait, tense.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF ABOVE ROCK QUARRY 50C
dialogues.text: Taraq reacts to the sound of Danny’s voice. Signals to his men. They start moving in on the SEALs SEALs IN THE ROCK QUARRY: 50D Axe slowly removing his hand from Danny’s mouth. Danny looking up wide eyed at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Mike?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: You got to be quiet Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: (whispering) I know. I just can’t get over how fast they are.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Faster than we are.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: They might be.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Mike how did they get on us so fast?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Don’t know. Don’t get it. Dietz is starting to lose it.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: Got on us pretty fast. I was talking to my mom, she didn’t say anything about it. Matty you see them?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I didn’t see until you did Danny.

dialogues.speaker: DIETZ
dialogues.text: So much fucking red man. Really vivid reds. Taliban voices growing louder. Luttrell looks to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We got to move Mike.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only option for movement is down. Another 80 ft. drop The rocks above Axelson start to shear. Incoming rounds. Above them silhouetted Taliban fighters. The team once again surrounded. Murphy starring down the cliff.  78.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Axe, how shot up are you? Axe looking down at himself. Inventorying his bullet woun

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I think three times. I’m hit three... I don’t know what this is. Blood oozing from the back of his head. Behind his right

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Are you good to move?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Move where?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We're going down. Axe looks downhill. AXE’s POV Another massive drop. Sharp Granite, trees, and a brutal pitch.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Hoo-yah to that Murph.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the back of Taraq, fighters on both sides. Slow mo a they move fast through, in front of them the ravine hidin the SEALs. Tight on Taraq. Smelling blood. Rage and hatred filled eyes. The Taliban fighters, like Apache warriors, picking up sp Guns up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Murphy looks to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Marcus, you good?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Danny? Incoming rounds starting to pick up intensity. The granit starting to vaporize all around them. Danny clicking back into a primal warrior mode. Up on his knees firing back. Marcus reaching for Danny pulling him down back into cove

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I got him. Murphy looks over the rock hide. MURPHY’S POV. Taraq with six fighters charging out of the tree line. Al AK's blasting.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Go! Go! Go! Move! Murphy pulling off the clip of a FRAG GRENADE. Hurls it a the charging Taliban as: Axe leaps off the cliff. 53A Murphy turns. Leaps. The grenade DETONATES. Killing two Taliban. Shah continues to charge. Luttrell hoists Dietz up and over his shoulder. Turning towards the cliff. He turns to fire a last burst Taraq. Marcus digs his back foot into the loose slate, ready to when: Taraq FIRES. Danny shot through the neck. Bullet passes through Danny’s neck tearing through the si of Luttrell’s neck. Luttrell screams in pain spinning, dropping Danny.
LUTTRELL and DIETZ separate. Danny falling onto the rock. Luttrell falling backwards off the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUTTRELL FALLING. 53B
dialogues.text: Another brutal fall. SMASHING BACKWARDS DOWN THE CLIFF. Luttrell tries grabbing for dirt, tree, or rock. Anything slow his fall. He slams through trees snapping thick branches. Bouncing rock. Luttrell disappears into the lower tree, brush line below

dialogues.speaker: DANNY DIETZ
dialogues.text: On his back. M4 by his side. Taraq and his fighters move in. More Taliban clearing the tree line behind them. Taraq looks down at Dietz’s body. Turns and looks down the cliff. Taraq reaches down, picks up Dietz’s M4. Looks it over. Reaches back down. Takes one of Danny’s Grenades.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNHILL. 53D
dialogues.text: Luttrell on his side struggling to get to his knees. Murp twenty feet away with Axe below him. MURPHY (CONT’D) Where’s Danny?

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF ABOVE ROCK QUARRY 53E
dialogues.text: Taraq pulls the pin on Dietz’s grenade. Hurls it down hil the direction of the three remaining SEALs.

dialogues.speaker: DOWNHILL. 53F
dialogues.text: His grenade comes in short. Blowing rock chunks and dirt the three SEALs.  54 55 81. MURPHY (CONT’D) Where the fuck is Danny?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight on the watch clock. ZULU time. Kristensen staring at it. Tapping his fingers on the tabl

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Try them again. Comms guy in the back of the room keys his radio mic.

dialogues.speaker: COMMS GUY
dialogues.text: Spartan 01, this is Anvil 1, do you copy? Spartan 01 do you copy? Radio Silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luttrell looking over to Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We got to get him. More grenades. RPG’s. Noise is deafening.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We got to get him. The three guys trying to communicate. All talking over ea other.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Where’s Danny? I can’t see him.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: How do you know he’s dead?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Danny’s dead.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Where?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: His fucking head blew off?  82.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Do you have Danny?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: In my fucking arms.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: We got to get down. Deafening EXPLOSIONS.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We got to get up there and get him.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: We got to get down now.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Do you know where he is? AXE MOVES CLOSER.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Is Danny hit?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Where is he hit?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: In the head.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Up on top.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: We got to get him. More explosions.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Let’s move right. Take the flank right. See if we can get back up there.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We'll get Danny. Get him down with us. Get off this hill. Take them on the flat ground.

dialogues.speaker: CLIFF ABOVE ROCK QUARRY 55A
dialogues.text: Taraq now with twenty fighters. Firing down hill. Throwin grenades. Ordering his men down the sides of the cliff.

dialogues.speaker: AXE 55B
dialogues.text: I think we can take them on the flat ground.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Let’s move. How much ammo do we have. Guys checking magazines.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I got seventy rounds. Three grenades.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fifty rounds. One grenade.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I got three full mags. Five Grenades.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Let’s suck it up that fucking hill.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Move. The three SEALs, guns up, firing up hill. As they attempt get back up to Danny. EXT. DANNY’S POSITION (CLIFF ABOVE QUARRY) 56 He’s not dead. Close. Shah, Taraq and his men staring ove him as he struggles back to his knees. Staring up at Tara through blood soaked eyes, broken, dying. Defiant. Danny refusing to go gently...His right hand fumbling for his f knife in his front pocket. Taraq just stares at Danny’s broken mangled fingers tryin open his knife. Drops it.

Danny looks down past his knife. The “Tile” samples page fallen out of his pocket. Blood stained. Danny stares at paper. Taraq slowly lifts his foot, pushes against Dietz’s chest Pushes him back down flat on his back.. Tight on Dietz dying, staring up at Taraq. Dietz slowly raises his blood soaked right hand up to Taraq.

dialogues.speaker: BELOW ROCK QUARRY CLIFF 56A
dialogues.text: Murphy is out in front. Clawing his way into the left sid the descending Taliban flank. Luttrell and Axe trying to lay down cover fire, shooting at Shah’s soldiers as they move down the right side of th Mountain. Even the Taliban are having a slow go of it on account of radical pitch. TIGHT WITH MURPHY. A leader desperately trying to make his way straight into teeth of the enemy to recover one of his men. A torrent of incoming gunfire blocking his advances. Luttrell twenty feet to his right trying to do the same. Axe staying below. Firing up the hill. HITS two TALIBAN a they move down the hill towards Murphy and Luttrell. ON LUTTRELL. The incoming fire has him pinned against a rock. He is desperate to find a way back up the hill. Peering around each side of the giant boulder. TWENTY FEET to his left Murphy is doing the same. They start moving and covering for each other. One shoots while the other moves fast to a higher covering rock. This is a desperate, clawing uphill mountain scramble. Tw men, like animals brutally determined to reclaim their fa brother. Tight on their hands, eyes, feet, sweat, blood and tears they crawl their way, inch by inch back up this brutal ro mountain.  85. They are able to ascend about thirty feet before they run of cover. MURPHY and LUTTRELL side by side. Bullets exploding all around them. Murphy’s got SAT phone out again trying to get a signal. got no line of sight. Can’t make the call.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know Mikey.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: There’s just so fucking many of them.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t think we can get him.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Fuck.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We got to get down.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Got to get to flat ground. Tight on Murphy taking in the entire situation. Taliban a around them. His gun shots. Axe. Down hill fighting. Cove them. Murphy studies the terrain. A jagged rock peak sticking o in the clear about fifty feet to his left.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We can’t get him Mikey.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We can get him.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We're gonna die if we don’t get off this mountain.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: We’re gonna get him.  86. Murphy’s fixated on the exposed rock area fifty feet abov him. He looks down hill to Axe. Desperately trying to keep the Taliban from getting at Luttrell and Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get us some help Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Mike, they’re coming straight above you and to your right. Murphy, SAT phone in hand, looks below to Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: I’m gonna get this call out.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Good luck on that one brother.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Marcus, look at me. Luttrell turns locks eyes with Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: I’m gonna make the call. Marcus looks past Murphy to the clear rock face above him Luttrell gets what Murphy is saying, what he’s about to d

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Mike.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: For what bro? Marcus takes a beat, looks away, then back at Murphy.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: That we haven’t killed more of ‘em.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Oh we’re gonna kill more of them. Bet on that Marcus. We’re gonna kill a lot more of them.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Roger that. Murphy digs into his pack, has three remaining mags, hand them to Luttrell. Luttrell slides them into his vest. Mur checks his M4, SAT phone in his left hand, M4 in his righ  57 87. He turns to Marcus, tears in both of their eyes.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Never out of the fight Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Never. Murphy turns, pushes up and simply stands. Completely exposed. He starts running uphill to the exposed rock, hitting send on the SAT phone. Luttrell and Axe lay down cover as Murph charges up the h taking repeated rounds. Legs, arms, guts, Murphy makes it the clearing, the SAT connection locks in. Murphy sits on rock oblivious to the incoming rounds. INT. TOC —- J-BAD 57 In the TOC a SAT phone rings. Hasslert, sitting by the communications equipment, stares at it, picks it up.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: J-Bad TOC -- ON THE MOUNTAIN, MURPHY’S CLEAR ROCK FACE.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Sir this is Lieutenant Mike Murphy. Spartan 01. We need immediate air support, immediate air support. Hasslert freezes for a microsecond. Then.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Roger Murphy. Can I have your ten digit grid. Hasslert hears gunfire and Murphy impaired breathing.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (vo on phone) We need help now! Need immediate CAS.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Roger that, I need your ten digit grid.

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: (vo on phone) We are headed down the ravine toward the Chichakel village.  58 88. Hasslert immediately on his computer firing on the secure intercut comms link, “micro chat”. Tight on Screen. As he types TIC! Troops in contact!

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Murphy can you get me the grids?

dialogues.speaker: MURPHY
dialogues.text: Please hurry. Sir. Thank you. In the TOC men start looking over as Hasslert types in th call for help.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: Jesus, I think we need the QRF. Tight on the computer screen, ‘Troops in Contact’ ‘Murphy in Trouble’. Tight on Erik Kristensen, eyes wide...reading the call fo help. He grabs the phone.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Let’s move guys. Let’s really move! EXT. MOUNTAIN - MURPHY’S CLEARING 58 Back to Murphy, SAT phone dead. He turns faces up hill as bullets rip into his chest. He keeps firing. Murphy starts moving up hill firing into the Taliban mass It’s a suicide march... Luttrell falls back to Axe as Murphy, multiple gun shots keeps firing. Murphy falls to his knees, screaming in pain...as Taragq his soldiers move in. Murphy slams his final magazine, blood pouring through hi NYFD patch, running down both arms. Murphy raises his M4, last full auto burst, hits three Taliban, as a final shot slams through the front of Murphy’s face blowing him backwards, completely flipping him head over heels landin his face.
Eyes still open Murphy’s last vision is his Iridium SAT phone. He can die knowing that he was able to make the ca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marines and SEALs scramble collecting weapons, sprinting the Blackhawks, Air Force pilots climbing into the Blackh firing engines. Track with Navy SEALs. Pete Musslemen stuffing magazines his vest, charging for a Blackhawk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking with Erik Kristensen, Dan Healy, James Suh as SE charge towards waiting 47's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nightstalker pilots and flight crew working feverishly to fire up the powerful Chinook engines. It's clearly all hands on deck as the helicopters are pac with SEALs armed to the teeth.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: I said let’s move! Track with Kristensen on the Chinook up to the pilot. The nightstalker pilot and Kristensen frantically confirm location waypoint of where they think the recon team shou logically be. CUT WIDE: As the two Chinooks loaded with SEALs lift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Blackhawk about to take off, when HASSLERT sprints ac the runway, charging to the lead Blackhawk, shaking his h eyes locked on Blackhawk pilot screaming,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Door flying open, Pete Musslemen heads out.  62 63 64 90.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: What’s the fucking problem? Hasslert charging toward Musslemen.

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: You’re grounded.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: What are you fucking talking about?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: You’re grounded, you have no Apache support. Blackhawks can’t go in without air cover. Musslemen looking around realizing the Apaches are not th

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: Where the fuck are the Apaches?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: We are trying to figure that out.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: Where are the fucking Apaches?!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kristensen’s lead 47. Kristensen is up with the Nightstal pilot. In the back of the chopper, packed, almost overflowing wi SEALs, the men check weapons. The Airforce Nightstalker pilots checking their 50 calibe side guns. Everyone silent and intense.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Musslemen out of his Blackhawk in the face of Hasslert  65

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: (screaming) Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: They're coming back.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: When?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: On their way now!

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: When will they fucking be here?

dialogues.speaker: HASSLERT
dialogues.text: 15 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: Are you fucking kidding me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus scrambling back with Axe, jammed behind rocks, tak heavy, heavy fire. Marcus digs in side by side with Axe. Both men shot up, l like hell.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Where’s Murphy? Luttrell doesn’t answer.

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Where's Mike?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Up top.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Where up fucking top?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: He’s getting the ORF. The incoming gunfire stopping. An eerie silence coming ov the hill. Just random Taliban voices. Calm. Distant.  66 92.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: What the fuck is going on?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Where exactly is Mikey?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know. More tears pouring down Axe and Luttrell’s faces. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) We gotta get down.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Did he make the call?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t know....we got to get off this hill Axe.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Do you think he made the call? Axe and Marcus staring into each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Chinook 47's, hauling ass. Back ramp open, Kriste standing over it. He looks ready to jump right now. Kristensen looks down a the steep mountains, back up to the following 47.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: (on radio) What’s the problem? INTERCUT with Musslemen on the grounded Blackhawk in J-Ba

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: (radio) The Apaches were pulled.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: (radio) Why?  93.

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: (radio) Some army troops in contact.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: (radio) Where are they?

dialogues.speaker: MUSSLEMEN
dialogues.text: They're saying 10 minutes out. Kristensen moving up to the pilots of his 47. Plugs into 47 comms.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: What’s the deal with the Apaches? The Blackhawks are grounded at J- Bad.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger that. Blackhawks need the air support.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: They should have boots on ground right the fuck now.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger that.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: What the fuck is the problem?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Not enough air assets in theatre, that’s the fucking problem.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: What’s our fucking ETA?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: 15 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Where are the Apaches?

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: 25 minutes.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Can you put us down without the Apaches?  67

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Not supposed to.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Will you put us down? Pilot pauses...looks to Kristensen.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: We'll do whatever we have to do to get you with your men.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luttrell and Axe trying to quietly climb their way down t mountain. Still a couple of hundred feet above the villag They are climbing, falling 10-20 ft. falls.

dialogues.speaker: UP MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Taragq tracking them. Shah, higher up communicating on ra

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two 47's. The 2nd 47 flies past Kristensen, taking th lead.

dialogues.speaker: PILOTS
dialogues.text: (misc comms) 1st 47 will fly over LZ make sure it’s clear. Kristensen’s 47 will be 1st to hover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Apaches show up. Tearing over the airfield. Hellf missile arrays and 40 mm front mounted getting guns.  70
The Blackhawks finally take off following the Apaches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tracking tight with Taraq. His worn sandaled feet slowly stepping down the mountain. He’s following blood drops. Tight on beaded stone necklace with seven American Dog Ta hanging from it like human scalps. Tight on a blood soaked dog tag: “Danny Dietz” We move across the faces of several of these Afghan warri They feel more like Comanche Indians than anything else. Fierce and focused, guns up, they hunt Americans.

dialogues.speaker: FURTHER DOWN
dialogues.text: Luttrell and Axe at a major cliff edge, looking back up...guns pointed up mountain. We pull wide and see just how close Tarag now is to Luttr and Axe, 100 ft. away, max. Closing in. On Luttrell - hearing Taragq and his men, whispering to A

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Come here Axe. Let me see you. Axe nods, blood slow running from his head shot down the back of the neck. Axe touches the wound.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Did they really shoot me in the head?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yea buddy. A moment of silence.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: It’s funny man. I thought it would feel worse you know.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yea.  96.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Mikey and Danny are really dead right?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yea.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Are we dead?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Negative.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: We're fucking good right? Axe stares at Luttrell. Marcus looks at his dying friend.

dialogues.speaker: AXE, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Marcus?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We're real good Axe. Real good. Mikey made the call. We just got to stay alive for fifteen minutes max.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Mikey made the call right?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Fuck yea he did.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: They’re coming.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Coming strong man.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Good. That’s good.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I don’t want em to get us with an RPG, Axe.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: If I fucking die you make sure Cindy knows how much I love her.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: She knows.  97.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: You tell her I died with my brothers. With a fucking full heart.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: We ain’t dying Axe. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Can you get to that rock over there? Axe looks behind him. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) With the dead black tree?

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Yea I can do that.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: You get there. I’m gonna move right. Cover each other.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: Did Mikey make the call?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Fifteen minutes brother. Stay strong Axe.

dialogues.speaker: AXE
dialogues.text: I'll do it.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Stay quiet. A nod from Axe and the two men split up. Axe moves to his left, Luttrell to his right. Tight on Axe. Shot up. Blood pouring from head wound. Tou Grinding it out. Staying low. Deep breathing. Grunting as crosses the mountain. Gun fire erupts around him. Turning, spots half a dozen Taliban on him. Axe pushes deeper into the woods. A hunted animal running of options.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: The same. Moving quiet in the other direction.  71 72 73 98. This is all very silent. Tense....Tarag like a hunting do dead quiet, Luttrell and Axe, the hunted, desperately try to stay quiet. On Luttrell - trying to move towards a large rock... His right foot digging in for traction, dislodges a small pebble... on that pebble picking up momentum, hitting sma pebbles, dislodging more little rocks... A mini avalanche hitting a bigger rock. Tight on Luttrell. Looking down at the small rock slide, hearing its noise.. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Shit. And they open fire again, bullets firing all around Luttr both Luttrell and Axe return fire. This is much closer gu fighting...grenades and RPG’s at close quarters. Men behi rocks, guns blazing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over the head of the lead pilot as he comes flying up tow the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: ON LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Mid gunfight he looks up as that big 47 flies up high ove them, over the top of the mountain. On Axe and Luttrell spotting the ORF.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Keep fighting Axe. Axe is fighting. Shot up but recharged by the 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too high to see the gunfight down below the pilot is focu on the landing area on top of the mountain. He does a lst by over the top. Looks clear.

dialogues.speaker: LEAD 47 PILOT
dialogues.text: (on radio) Looks good. Looks quiet.  99.

dialogues.speaker: 2ND 47 PILOT
dialogues.text: Roger that we’re good to drop. The second 47 pulls up over the LZ. Ramp down, fast rope out. The SEALs, lead by Kristensen, ready to fast rope out.... The TF 160 gunners alert, scanning behind their 50 Cal. Machine guns. The 47 pulls up, high hover, 80 ft. drop. Tight on Kristensen His hands around the fast rope....

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Let’s do this. Patton, you're first move! Shane Patton, can’t help but grin, he’s on his feet movin towards the open door.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: You good?

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Couldn’t be more good.

dialogues.speaker: KRISTENSEN
dialogues.text: Glorious opportunity here, Mr. Patton.

dialogues.speaker: SHANE PATTON
dialogues.text: Yes sir. Kristensen has one foot out of the chopper when... Movement on the ground. 50 Cal gunner catches the reflection of something metalli small detonation from the ground. Then terrifying sights incoming ordinance.

dialogues.speaker: RPG
dialogues.text: Tight on Kristensen and Patton looking down as the RPG ro flies into the chopper right past them, literally into th 47.  74 99A.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Chinook explodes. Ripping apart, tilting, rotor blades immediately tearing treetops then thick tree trunks - like massive buzz saws the chopper turns and burns.

dialogues.speaker: 74B
dialogues.text: 75 76 100. Rocks and trees churn, bodies break and burn and die as t big Chinook 47 rips apart exploding and tumbling down the mountain.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN RANGE
dialogues.text: ON LUTTRELL - peering up at the explosion. 74A Luttrell watches wide-eyed as his teammates smash and bur

dialogues.speaker: ON THE FIRST 47
dialogues.text: Banks hard as the Taliban fire more RPG’s and small arms up at it-

dialogues.speaker: INT. 47
dialogues.text: Argument breaking out between SEAL Lt. and Airforce Pilot SEAL LT. You got to put us down now!

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: No fucking way. SEAL LT. Now! As the SEALs on the chopper start breaking out the window firing their M-4’s out the window, Airforce gunmen open u the 50 cals. Massive fire power blasting out from the choppers.

dialogues.speaker: MOUNTAIN ABOVE VILLAGE
dialogues.text: Marcus looking cross mountain at Axe who has managed to transverse one hundred feet of the mountain and is leadin small pack of Shah’s men away from Luttrell. Axe starts taking heavy fire. Shot twice through the thro Falling backwards. Trying to get up. Back to his weapon. AXE DYING. Marcus watching helpless from across the mountain. Trying cover Axe as the Taliban move in on him. Not all of them have followed Axe because as Marcus turns back an RPG blows ten feet in front of him. Shrapnel and smashing into the side of his head. His Helmet tears off his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 77 101. Tight on Marcus rolling backwards. Falling. Tumbling furt down the mountain. Tight on his helmet, Texas flag painted bold across it. Rolling and smashing down the mountain. He comes to a hard stop slamming the back of his exposed into a rock. Tight on Marcus. Close to unconscious. Very dazed, Very confused. MARCUS POV. Distorted visuals. Triple vision. No sound except emergin high pitched ringing. Marcus is deaf. He stares up at this apoplectic mountain in dazed wonder.

dialogues.speaker: INT. 47
dialogues.text: The SEAL Lt. screaming at the Airforce Pilot. SEAL LT. Open the ramp.

dialogues.speaker: PILOT
dialogues.text: Negative. SEAL LT. Open the goddamned ramp. The Lt. has to be restrained, physically pulled back by t SEALs. Everyone screaming at each other. Co-Pilot on radio putting out distress signal calling in downed 47 to Bagram.

dialogues.speaker: CO PILOT
dialogues.text: We have a downed 47, repeat a downed 47.  78 79 80

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the big command center. Not just SEALs, everybody Army, Navy, Airforce, Marines. Shots of a massive response mobilization. AWACS, C-130s, Choppers filling with Delta, Green Berets, Group. Aircraft taking off. F18 fighter jets vectoring towards downed chopper.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marcus, hearing utterly fucked....getting closer to the village. Picking his way down hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chopper slow banking a mile off the crash sight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The two Apaches pulling ahead of the Blackhawks. Passing 47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pilots star warred up. Flying straight at the burning mountain top.

dialogues.speaker: ON THE MOUNTAIN
dialogues.text: Taraq and his men hear the incoming Apaches. Shah orders his men to take cover. The Taliban quickly becoming invisible from the sky.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN HILL
dialogues.text: Marcus deaf to the incoming Apaches. Has no idea how clos they are. As he falls, gets up, off balance stumbles off ft drop. This time not so lucky with his landing, comes down hard, shatters his right shin, bone tears through his skin, compound fracture. Screaming in pain, Luttrell crawls into a rock crevasse. Hiding, he attempts to clear his head. We play all of Luttrell’s audio perspective here as deaf. Abstract surges of sound. He’s basically deaf. The Apaches fly high over head. Missing Luttrell. Disappearing over mountain tops as they keep moving to av enemy ground fire. Struggling to silence his hysterical breathing, Luttrell hides as Taraq and his men move all around him. Luttrell shadows of the fighters. He silently starts covering hims with rocks and dirt. Luttrell well hidden. We slowly push in on him as his head starts to nod forwar He lifts it. Fighting the powerful urge for sleep. It fal again. He lifts it. Leaning his head back against the crevasse wall. Taraq and his men back on the hunt. Searching rock to roc Tight on Luttrell. Head back. Breathing slower. As Luttre falls to sleep. FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 84 104. SILENT.

dialogues.speaker: OVER BLACK A84
dialogues.text: The faint singing of morning birds. Growing louder. SLOW FADE UP.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking out at entire Hindu Kush Mountain range as the su slowly rises behind the tallest peak. STUNNING SUNRISE. INT. LUTTRELL’S HIDE 84 TIGHT ON MARCUS. Looks DEAD. EYES TWITCH. SLOWLY OPEN. LUTTRELL wakes up. Disoriented. First thing he notices is the bird sitting u a rock above him. He hears it. Sort of. Faded. Loud then silent. His hearing has partially returned. LUTTRELL very slowly clears himself from the dirt and roc hide. Inventories himself, his weapons. Two magazines, two grenades. No food. No water. Bleeding has stopped from his gunshot. Leg is fucked up. bone busting out. Luttrell sits down. Examining his leg. Probing the bone. off his pants exposing his broken leg in UA shorts. Tears welling he bites down on his lips as he resets the broken bone. Jamming it back inside his skin. Tucking back the bone. Luttrell packs the puncture wound with dirt. Starts massa his dead legs. Forcing blood back into them. Deep powerfu breathing as he starts to will his body back into life.  85 105. EXT. LUTTRELL’S HIDE 85 Luttrell slowly moves out of the hide scanning the area f any sign of Taraq or Shah. Luttrell sees nothing. The village is close. Couple of hundred yards. LUTTRELL moves out. Slowly picking his way down towards t village. At fifty yards Luttrell pulls up. Takes cover behind some rocks. Stares down at the village through his M4 scope. LUTTRELL’S POV Early morning. Women light fires. Buckets of water. Tight on Luttrell’s blistered, cracked bone dry lips as h stares through his scope at the water. We can feel his desperate thirst. He stares at the water. Then voices pull his scope left. LUTTRELL’s POV. The two goat boys moving through the village. Tight on Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: (whispering) Motherfuckers. He’s got the kids in his scope. Dead to rights. Luttrell’s finger on the trigger. The older teenage goat herder’s face fills his scope... Then more voices. Luttrell pans right.

dialogues.speaker: TALIBAN
dialogues.text: Five men. Armed.  86 87

Moving through the village. Passing the boys. Tight on Marcus. His finger slowly off the trigger. Luttrell lowers his weapon. Looks to his left. LUTTRELL’S POV. A faint dirt trail below him leading away from the villag Slowly and silently Luttrell moves out towards that trail Away from the village. TRACKING with Luttrell. Slow going. He starts to put dist between himself and the village.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The main control center. The recovery of the dead chopper team and speculation ove the fate of the four man recon team.

dialogues.speaker: ARMY INTEL GUY
dialogues.text: We can confirm that there are no survivors from the 47 and we think we have recovered the bodies of Murphy and Dietz. Army Captains stare in furious silence. ARMY INTEL GUY (CONT’D) Axelson and Luttrell still unaccounted for.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT 87
dialogues.text: Unarmed predator drones circling the area. As Special Ops move in and secure the area around the downed chopper.

dialogues.speaker: 89A
dialogues.text: 90 Luttrell hobbles and falls and crawls through the woods. Falling, getting up. Refusing to stop. A desperate search for water.

dialogues.speaker: OMIT
dialogues.text: In the WOODS. Tracking with Luttrell. He’s running out of gas. Falling, crawling...grinding it out. He falls. On his hands and knees. Stops, head down. Hears something. Lifts his head. Looks off to his left. A WOLF. Male, large and powerful. The wolf studies Luttrell. Luttrell studies the wolf.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No menace just mutual curiosity. Luttrell picks himself up. Studies the wolf closely. Water drips off the side of the Wolf's face. His coat seems wet. Luttrell turns. Listens. HEARS the SOUND of falling water. TRACK with Luttrell towards the sound of the water. Luttrell moves to 20 ft. waterfall, pouring into a beauti clear pool of crystal clear fresh water. Luttrell tries to slide down the steep cliff sides of the water pool. Too excited, moving too fast, Luttrell slips, falling, tumbling. He falls fast into the water. UNDERWATER. Luttrell cuts through the water. Like a baptism as the co water surrounds him. Luttrell stays under water. Eyes clo Feeling it. Finally comes up. SURFACES. Swims to the shore on his hands and knees. LUTTRELL drinks. And drinks...... Slurping like a broken animal. Grabbing for hunks of water plants. Luttrell eats. Shovin the plants into his mouth. Desperate for any kind of ener TIGHT on LUTTRELL. Slowly freezes. Senses something. Slowly looks up. LUTTRELL’S POV: Three Afghan men. One man we recognize as Gulab.  110. A young Afghan boy. NOT Taraq’s crew. Three different men. One holds a machete. Staring down at this broken SEAL. Luttrell stares back at these men. A moment of silence. Then. Luttrell reaches for a grenade. Pulls the pin. Holds the armed grenade. The Afghan men appear non pulsed.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Stay back. The men just stare with curiosity. Luttrell holds up his grenade. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) I don’t care. You understand? I don’t care. I will kill us all. Finally one of the Afghans. A 30 year old male GULAB, the leader, strong rugged handsome, steps forward. Hands up i peace.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Not Taliban. Luttrell studies Gulab. Looks deep into his eyes. Luttrell looks from Gulab to the other Afghan men. Their faces seem kind. Nothing like the death looks we have see from the Taliban.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Come. Gulab slowly stepping to and reaching for Luttrell. Voices heard from deeper into the woods. Taraq and his crew getting closer. One of Gulab’s men says something quiet to Gulab.  111. Gulab reaches his hand out to Luttrell... Luttrell looks deep into Gulab’s eyes. Armed grenade in one hand, Luttrell slowly reaches his ri bleeding hand out. Tight on two hands grabbing each other. As they pull him up, out of the stream, voices of Taragq his men suddenly much closer. Gulab whispers something to one of his men. Luttrell is quickly pushed down into a crevasse between t rocks. A young Afghan boy sits on top of Luttrell hiding him further. Luttrell eyes wide, clutching his grenade. The young boy gently patting Luttrell’s back, trying to c him.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG BOY
dialogues.text: (whispering) Shuuuu....shuuuuu As Taraq with three Taliban fighters crest the cliff look down at the pond. At Gulab and his three men. A young boy sitting on a rock A stare off as the armed Taliban look down at the unarmed Gulab and his Villagers.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: (not particularly friendly) From what Village are you?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Peace be with you my brother we are from Kandish.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: And are you in Kandish true believers and correct in your thinking?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: We are my brother.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Da kom kali yee?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Pa khair zma wrora, mong da Kandish you.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Aya Tasey da kandish khalgh rekhteney musalmanan yastey ao da sahee fikrono khawandan ye?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Aw baley zamaa rora.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have you or any of your brothers seen the Americans moving through these woods?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: You are the only people we have seen. Taraq studies Gulab. Looks closely. TARAQ’s POV 112.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Aya ta ya sta wronoo americayan garzedal de largo taraf ta da Amrecayano ledely?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Tasey yawazaney khalk ye che mong waledaley. Luttrell’s blood on his right hand. A drop drips into the water.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Is something wrong with your hand?

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Aya sta lass Khog dey? Gulab holds Taraq’s gaze. Doesn’t look at the blood.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: We have been cutting trees all day my friend. Usually there is much more blood. In the CREVASSE.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Dosta, Monga tola wraz waney ghosawoo, Zyatara wakht zmong lawsoona weeney kege. Luttrell is freaking out. Hyperventilating. The young boy keeps gently patting his back. Taraq studies Gulab on more beat.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: If you see the Americans. Tell us or we will take your heads.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: I understand.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Peace be with you my brother.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: And may peace be with you as well my brother.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Ka taso americayan woledel. Mong ta malomat rakey ao ka na mong ba staso sarona ghos kro.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Za pohegam.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Zma wrora Allah de pa man ke lara.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Allah de ta hum pa aman ke dare.  112A. Taragq and his men take off. Hold on Gulab and his men a couple of beats.  91 92 93 113. Gulab signals to one man who quickly and silently moves u the little cliff. Signals that it is clear. Gulab quickly moves to a very confused Luttrell, pulling out of the crevasse.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Why are you helping me?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: No Taliban. On Luttrell as the Afghans quickly move him into the wood The little Afghan boy continues patting Luttrell’s leg fo comfort.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frantic activity as rescue teams are tracked. SEALs, Rang Green Berets, Marines. Small tracking teams inserted all throughout the area. Each assigned to different villages. Tight on a map as we see the KANDISH village. EXT. GULAB’S VILLAGE 92 Luttrell with Gulab and the Afghans being led into the sm village. He’s walking weak with an arm on Gulab’s shoulde the grenade still tight in right hand. Luttrell’s POV: The Village. Men women, children, animals all staring at Giant broken American. An alien entering their world. Marcus staring back in equal confusion. Locking eyes with 90 year old woman. The young boy by his side points to the woman. Has a conversation with her. Pointing to Marcus’s Texas leg. INT. GULAB’S HOUSE 93 Luttrell laid down on a mattress.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: We get Americans for you.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Do you know where to find the Americans?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Yes, we know.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Pen? Paper? Please. A pen and note paper are produced. Luttrell scribbles a n Identifying himself, asking for assistance. Gulab takes the note, gives it to his father, a fifty-eig year-old Afghan mountain man, strong muscle. The trekker pockets the note, heads out of the village, 9 disappears up into the mountain. Stay with Luttrell and Gulab. Luttrell looks from Gulab t the little boy, slowly puts pin back in grenade. Then fro outside, loud voices ARGUING. Track with Gulab outside to the edge of the village. 93Cc Taraq with five men. He looks pissed.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ TARAQ
dialogues.text: We want the American. Mong Americaye ghawaro.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB GULAB
dialogues.text: Please leave our village. Mehrabani okey zamonga kali perigadey

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ TARAQ
dialogues.text: This village has supported Da dey kali khalgo the Americans. Americayano sara marasta kari da.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB GULAB
dialogues.text: We want no trouble with you, Mong taso sara hes moshkel n please leave. ghawaro, mehrabani/lutfan da dey zaya larr shey. Taraq studies Gulab a beat, then without warning smashes in the side of the face. Gulab takes a knee. Looks up. Tarag hits him again. Pure humiliation. Tight on Gulab, tears water, as he summons his courage an stands tall, defiant, eyes blazing back at Taraq.  94 INT. LUTTRELL’S ROOM 115. 94 Luttrell’s room as Taraq and his men come smashing throug the door. Luttrell weak, tries to get up, is smashed down to the fl by Taraq. Luttrell tries to fight back. He is too weak, he is kicke and pounded viscously by Tarag and his men. Grenade just of reach. Luttrell is flipped on his back. Arms and legs held down Taraq gets on top of him, knife out.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: What base are you from? Luttrell’s head held back, neck exposed, Taragq moves in the blade.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: What unit are you from? When the door is kicked open. Gulab AK-47 aimed at Taraq, two armed villagers behind hi From the windows, an old man with a shotgun. Screaming an chaos. Eight armed Afghans in a small room. Screaming at other. Guns up. Taraq freezes. Out the window he sees five more of Gulab’ villagers - guns up.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Enough. Taraq slowly stands.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: You are making a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: You will not harm this man in my home.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Then let us take him.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: He is my guest. You will leave our village.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: bas.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Tasey ghalatey kawey.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Ta ba zama pa koor ki dey sara ta hes na waye.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: No bya zey che we neso.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: hagha zama milma day. Taso zmong da kali wozey.  95 96 97

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: We will come back.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Then you will fight my entire tribe. 116.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Mong ba bia razo.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Bya ba zma tola qabila staey khilaf jange kawe. A tense stand off, Taraq staring at Gulab. He and his men slowly release Luttrell...move out past Gulab.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: For an American you will all die. Do you understand that?

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Stay away from this village.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Da yao Americayee da para ba taso toll mrey. Aya taso powhegey

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: Da dey kali na larey osey. They stare inches apart. Taraq smiles, orders his men out Taraq stops, turns back, faces the entire village.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: You have all made your choice, you have declared your side and for this all men, women, children will be slaughtered. All of you.

dialogues.speaker: TARAQ
dialogues.text: Taso tolo khapal fareeq aw khawakha malooma kra, da dey pa waja ba tol nareena, khazena aw moshoman mrey. Tasey tol. Tight on Gulab trembling trying his best to show no fear. Tight shots of Gulab’s villagers; farmers with guns, all them trembling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 95 The old men with the note from Luttrell treks hard and fa over the mountains.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 96 Tarag on cell phone as he climbs up a small hill overlook Gulab’s village. Taraq’s calling in more men, waiting. EXT. GULAB’S VILLAGE 97 Gulab and three of his tribesmen having a heated conversation, argument over Luttrell. Feels similar to th SEALs debating the ROE on the mountain top.  116A. Women in packs watch from a distance.  98 117. INT. GULAB’S HOUSE 98 The little boy squatting on floor next to Luttrell, won't take his eyes off him. An odd staring contest.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: What’s your name? The boy just stares.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: Name? Nothing. Luttrell looks down at his gunshot wounds, still seeping blood. He looks to the young boy.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Hey. The boy looks at Luttrell. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Come. Come. Luttrell gestures for the boy to come over. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Knife. The boy is confused. Just stares at Luttrell. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Knife. Luttrell finds a little piece of wood on the cave floor, picks it up. Makes a cutting move with it. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Knife.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Knife.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Go get knife.  99 100 118.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shah, with five more heavily armed Taliban, join Taraq in woods. Brief conversation in Arabic -- Taraq briefs Shah situation. Now ten in total, they stare down at Gulab’s village. INT. GULAB’S HOUSE 100 The little boy has brought back a small live duck. Presen it to Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: (confused) What is that? The kid silently holds the duck out to Luttrell. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) I said knife.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Knife.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: That’s not a knife.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Not a knife.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: That’s a fucking duck.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: That’s a fucking duck.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: I need a knife!

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Knife!

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: For my leg!

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: For my leg! Gulab enters looking down at Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Please. I need a knife.  101

dialogues.speaker: 101B
dialogues.text: 102 103 119. Gulab staring down at Luttrell. Moves to the back of the house, comes back with a large knife. Gruesome bullet removing sequence. Blood. Screaming diggi scraping out bullets and shrapnel from Luttrell’s back an legs. Gulab digs with a knife. Pours water on the wounds. little boy holds Luttrell’s hands and whispers to him. Luttrell passes out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Under the full moon the trekker moves across a mountain t Gulab and his villagers stand watch over their village. 1 Luttrell sleeps. His fever burning. 101B

dialogues.speaker: SUNRISE
dialogues.text: EXT. HILLS ABOVE GULAB’S VILLAGE 102 Taraq and Shah, now with fifty men. Heavily armed. AKS an RPGS, Shah gives orders. The men break into three groups. Moving out to flank the village. Gulab’s villagers still on watch. The town feels locked d like an old western.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Secure phone rings. Marine answers it.

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: We've got a report of a letter asking for assistance.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: From who?

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: Marcus Luttrell. Sir, they dida hand writing comparison and its does appear to be Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Where is he?

dialogues.speaker: MARINE
dialogues.text: KANDISH Village.

dialogues.speaker: COMMANDER
dialogues.text: Go get him son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “HAND OF GOD”. A high altitude attack aircraft capabl of striking targets from 25,000 feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: C-130 pilots getting instructions to move into the Kandis Village area. Gunmen settling into fire positions. INT. GULAB’S HOUSE 105 Luttrell wakes. A small fire. Gulab and the little boy staring at Luttrell. Luttrell struggles to sit up. Gulab hands him water. Luttrell drinks in massive gulps. Choking. Gulab takes water bottle from Marcus.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: (arabic) Slow. Gulab hands Luttrell a bowl of cooked Lamb. Luttrell starts inhaling the meat. Fist fulls. As he star choking.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: (arabic) Slow. Luttrell nods. Trying to slow down. Trying to show a semblance of control. Gulab points to the Texas flag on Marcus’s vest.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: America?

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Texas.

dialogues.speaker: GULAB
dialogues.text: America?  106 121.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Yes. America. Texas is America, Yes.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Tex.

dialogues.speaker: MARCUS
dialogues.text: Texas.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE BOY
dialogues.text: Texas. Luttrell eyes the water bottle.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: More water. Please. Gulab hands Marcus the bottle. Again he starts drinking i desperate, choking gulps. The little boy laughing at Luttrell’s ravenous thirst. Gulab a small smile. The little boy and Gulab just stare. As Luttrell finishes the meat and drinks all the water. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) I don’t know why your doing this for me. Gulab and the little boy staring at Marcus. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Thank you. The two men staring at each other as an incoming RPG slam into the house. Huge explosion. Frantic screaming from outside. Gulab up and out first. Luttrell struggles to stand. The little boy moving to Luttrell helping him up. Luttrell grabbing his vest and g moving out just as a 2nd RPG detonates destroying the res Gulab’s house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TARAQ attacks with his men. Brutal fight. Hand to hand, gun on gun. Gulab shot, Marcu shot again. The Taliban is about to kill Marcus when the little boy calls out to Marcus.

The Taliban is on top of Luttrell, choking him, killing h Luttrell’s hands clawing at the man, digging into earth, grasping for wood, a stone, anything...when...a KNIFE, is slapped into Luttrell’s hand. Luttrell looks up, the litt boy. Staring at Luttrell. Marcus buries the knife into the neck of the fighter. Rolling out as the building in front of them detonates. H machine gunfire tearing it up. Luttrell and Shah fall bac woman charges out grabbing the little boy. Eye contact wi Luttrell as he is carried away. Gulab and Marcus pinned down...Taraq moving in. Taragq is about to win. When off camera, Luttrell looking up at the empty sky, he hears something.

dialogues.speaker: THUMP THUMP THUMP
dialogues.text: Silent. Then. Giant explosions all around Luttrell. Taliban blowing up if HAND of GOD was attacking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We see gunners targeting. The 40mm firing with extreme precision. Luttrell looks up behind him. 106B Two American Apaches, flanking two Blackhawks.

dialogues.speaker: HIGHER 106C
dialogues.text: C-130 gunship starts slow banking... Tight on pilots, gunmen, ammo, fingers on triggers...sigh locked in... On the ground... 106D All gunships open fire, the ground around the village eru Taliban shredded. Taliban trying to run away. Shredded by the Apaches. The 130. Tarag turns...starts to run away. Tight on Luttrell, gun up. Tight on Gulab, gun up...  107 123. POV: Both sights, Taragq’s head full frame. Both men take a breath...

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Glorious Day. Gulab fires first. On Taraq, running towards us full frame as... Gulab’s bullet slams into the side of Taraq...spinning hi around as...Luttrell’s bullet takes his head off...Taraq falling slow and hard. Dead. Tight on Luttrell and Gulab. Apaches circling over head as two Blackhawks land behind them. Air Force Search and Rescue Helicopter airmen charge out the chopper towards Luttrell.

dialogues.speaker: CREW CHIEF
dialogues.text: Luttrell?

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Yes sir.

dialogues.speaker: CREW CHIEF
dialogues.text: It’s time to go home. The Airmen reach for Luttrell. Luttrell won't let go of Gulab. They hold each other like life long brothers. The US Airmen separate Marcus from Gulab. Marcus is too w to resist.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Luttrell loaded in the chopper, looks back at Gulab, reac for him. Gulab takes his hand.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: He comes with me. Luttrell’s hand is gently separated from Gulab as Green Berets move into the village. Gulab steps back as the chopper takes off. Tight on Luttrell, weak eyes open, glassed up.  123A. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) There is a randomness to life. A luck, a rhythm that is beyond my ability to understand.  108 124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flying fast over the Afghan mountains. Luttrell beaten and broken, but clear-eyed... Staring down at the vast epic Afghan mountain range.

dialogues.speaker: LUTTRELL
dialogues.text: Brave men have fought and died building the proud tradition and fear of reputation that I am bound to uphold. The mighty Hindu Kush... As the sun sets... Back to opening. Doctor’s working franticly to save Luttr LUTTRELL (CONT’D) I died up on that mountain. There's no question a part of me will forever be up on that mountain dead as my brothers died. Close on heart monitor. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) But, there is a part of me that lived. Because of my brothers, because of them, I am still alive, and I can never forget that no matter how much it hurts, how dark it gets, how far you fall... From flatline to a heartbeat. LUTTRELL(CONT’D) You are never out of the fight. LONE SURVIVOR.
